On the top floor, there was a spa, lounge, and access to the roof that went all the way around the building to offer great views of the city. The Consierge was knowledgeable, helpful and fun to chat with. The desk staff and bellmen also knew how to help us, or just pass the time of day. Over all, our stay was delightful. The only bump in the stay was trouble with the cable tv, but that was fixed in short order. I'd go back in a blink.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience.”
Reviews.Author: ebbysmom
Reviews.Content: Have never stayed at the Donatello before, but saw their ad in the Pink Section of the Chronicle and was impressed with the rate and the fact parking was included. Was especially pleased with the convenience to shopping.etc. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The bellmen were always there to summon a cab when we needed one. The desk staff was very friendly and welcoming. When I checked out I made a reservation for an overnight stay in January.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to be treated with good friendly service, and an enjoyable stay, The Donatello is the place.”
Reviews.Author: Frankenstein73
Reviews.Content: We were so pleased at our choice for our trip and overnite stay. Being able to park without a charge was a great incentive, and helped to make the Donatello our choice. We had never stayed before. Your staff made us feel welcomed, and we enjoyed the free coffee in the Club with the wiew. We will definitley return. As native San Franciscans we enjoyed our short visit.

Reviews.Title: “The Donatello provides luxury and a perfect location for a pittance.”
Reviews.Author: SoBeRetired
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visit San Francisco frequently, usually twice a year, and the Donatello is the best value we have ever found. The service from check-in through check-out was warm, friendly, and efficient. Our large corner room was full of light and large, basically a suite. It contained all the amenities we could ask for: tv, internet, refrigerator, microwave, dishes, wine glasses, coffee maker (with good coffee), phone, radio, CD player, and so on. The linens and towels were luxurious, what one expects from a hotel charging two or three times what we paid. The Donatello has a restaurant and a small piano bar. We used the latter and enjoyed that, too. Our Tanqueray martinis were about $10 each, significantly less that we are accustomed to in our home town (Miami Beach) or bars we typically visit in NYC or SF. And of course the hotel is about a block from Union Square and a short walk to the Powell St BART stop. What a wonderful establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: lakecanon
Reviews.Content: Just spent 2 nights here to enjoy some city culture and shopping. Great location for both! The staff is very friendly and attentive and the head concierge knows about all the restaurants nearby. Nice fitness center with sauna and co-ed jacuzzi too. Had a very good dinner at the hotel restuarant. the creamy polenta appetizer was divine and big enough for an entree serving. The only negative, the continental breakfast for $10pp was less than impressive. Many good cafes and restuarants within a block.

Reviews.Title: “Old folks home”
Reviews.Author: RickAndFamily
Reviews.Content: Our presence at the wine and cheese tasting that night dropped the average age of the room by half.... and we're in our 40's!! Place was nice enough, nothing noteworthy except for most of the guests being in their 80's. First thing you'll see when you enter the room is a hidious bed spread on the bed. Didn't want to even sit on it thinking how old and dirty it could be. Thankfully, later that evening, hotel staff folds it away and stashes it in the closet. Actually, made the room suprisingly nicer once it was gone. Nothing to complain about, but nothing to brag about either.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel room in ideal location”
Reviews.Author: PortlandOldGold
Reviews.Content: The Donatello, which seems to be part time-share and part hotel, is a comfortable and attractive property in an ideal San Francisco location just a block from Union Square. The hotel has its own small restaurant and a lively cocktail lounge, and the hotel staff are helpful, friendly, and attentive to special needs. Rooms are ample in size and comfortable, with some of the usual extras found in time-shares (dishes, small appliances, etc.). The whole hotel is very clean and well maintained, and if you have a problem, someone is there right away to take care of it. There are several excellent restaurants within a few blocks, and the theater playhouses are just around the block.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, service and location”
Reviews.Author: hilldown
Reviews.Content: I arranged a conference based on at the Donatello and stayed with clients for a week. The hotel is elegant and very well kept. Rooms are big and comfy with nice amenities, like a kitchenette with fridge, sink, microwave and coffemaker. Big tv, dvd player and sofa group. The location one block from union square is excellent. Right in the middle of the shopping and entertainment district yet quiet. The hotel has a great roof terrace and a comfortable common room on the top floor next to their fitness center. The level of service we received both before we arrived and during our stay from all employees was excellent. No question to small, no challenge to big. I will definitely use this hotel the next time I'm in San Francisco wheter I go for business or vacation with my family. I have never received this level of service and such high standard rooms and amenities for such a low price in the US. The only complaint is that the free wifi was a bit slow, especially in the meeting room when 14 of us were online at the same time. This however does not stop me from recommending this hotel warmly to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: bbz123
Reviews.Content: After a really poor experience at a one letter hotel, it was wonderful to be treated so well by the entire staff. Room was top-notch, food great, facilities fabulous. I will stay there whenever I spend the night in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Service..A+ Location..Clean Spacious Rooms”
Reviews.Author: DenverStatman
Reviews.Content: So close to everything you would want. Located in the heart of Union Square, lots of great dining choices nearby, close to cable car lines and other public transportation. Large rooms for San Francisco with very comfortable beds! The staff was extra friendly and helpful. Free in room coffee and newspaper daily. We will most certainly stay here when we visit San Francisco again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: papajym
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Donatello before our rooms were ready and had plans for lunch and than a night trip to Alcatraz. The front desk said no problem we will have your bags in your rooms when you get back. We asked for directions to the waterfront and said we wanted to walk. They gave us the best directions for staying on the flat ground. After a fun night on "The Rock", we made our way back to the hotel via cable car. Our bags were all set up in our rooms as promised. The next day I asked the best way to the freeway to get to Napa. The directions were very accuarte. After a hard day tasting wine we arrived back to comfortable rooms and beds. The staff were very accomadating and encouraged the use of the concierge if we needed anything. The hotel is in the heart of the city. Close to Union Square, shopping, cable cars and dining. I would highly recommend staying at the Donatello if you are going to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: UMICHUsa
Reviews.Content: The Donatello is very nice hotel. The rooms are huge and very clean. Good and new beds. The staffs are very polite. It is very close to Union Square, just 2 blocks. The trolley pass just 1 block and and their restaurant is very good with alive music.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms and service”
Reviews.Author: irishtraveller82
Reviews.Content: Our group of 6 girls stayed in this hotel for a few days in October. We really enjoyed our stay here. From check in, where a very kind gentleman checked us in to the rooms which were spacious and clean. Location was great, just a few mins walk to union square (close to thye shops) and mins from most buses and trams. This hotel was great value for money and so too was our breakfast. we ate in the hotel also and were treated very well to a lovely meal. Rooms were cleaned daily. Staff were friendly and helpful. Really recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean spacious room, great location”
Reviews.Author: AFeygin
Reviews.Content: The hotel is definitely aging--especially the elevators, but the nice clean spacious rooms, great location (a block from Union Square and close to everything), and attentive staff more than make up for it. The room was very comfortable, with turn-down service every evening. Bathroom was nice, great water pressure in the shower. Only two complaints: 1. I was on the 10th floor and could still hear a lot of street noise from below. I had to turn on the fan to block it out so I could sleep, but that's the price to pay for being right in the middle of everything. 2. Relatively pricey, especially if you have a car to park. Also, I would skip the $7 breakfast...it's not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “The Prefect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jaynejames
Reviews.Content: Have visited San Francisco several times and this was the best hotel we have stayed in Clean and very comfortable with very helpful and friendly staff. Would be happy to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: hoycie
Reviews.Content: My friend and I had our "girls" weekend away in San Francisco. For the thrid year in a row we've stayed at the Donatello Hotel and enjoyed it. My husband and I stay there whenever we're in San Francisco. Our room is always spacious, clean and quiet. The location is perfect for shopping and dining. They have a nice guest floor where they serve coffed in the morning. All the staff is friendly and extremely helpful. We look forward to it every year.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience, I have stayed At the Donatello 6-8 times & delighted with my time there”
Reviews.Author: WiseRiverFan
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very spacious with "over the top" superior beds. When traveling a great night sleep is very important to me. The amenities and cleanliness is excellent, also. I have felt that the staff: housekeeping, bellmen, and front desk people have always treated me like they are anxious to assist me while I am a guest in the hotel. I have stayed at the Donatello 6 to 8 times, sometimes with my husband, daughter, granddaughter or a girlfriend and each of my guests were impressed with the Hotel. I especially enjoy the fact that it is one block to Union Square shopping, Theaters and great restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, corporate attitude towards guests”
Reviews.Author: joannova
Reviews.Content: Large, newly updated rooms, in a convenient Union Square location. Staff very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Bang for the Buck”
Reviews.Author: NMTaosena
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel - the second time I've stayed here. The rooms are very spacious, and immaculately clean. Very comfortable bed. The front desk staff and concierges are friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. Its location, one block from Union Square, can't be beat. Small quibbles - the bathrooms are small-ish and somewhat dated, and I personally prefer a down comforter to a heavy bedspread. But all in all the Donatello offers you a large clean comfortable room, an excellent stay and great value.

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: TY41550
Reviews.Content: I have always enjoyed staying at the Donatello. The staff is so helpful and accommodating. The rooms are comfortable and first class. Thanks again for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Carol059
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. We had a large studio room on the 9th floor. King size bed with fold out sofabed for our teenager. Very spacious room even with leaving the foldout sofa open the entire time we were there. Very clean room and bathroom. Very helpful and friendly staff. Concierge very available for reservations, suggestions, etc. Valet for parking your car or catching you a taxi. Desk staff very friendly. Daily maid service and nightly turn-down service with chocolates. Everyone very professional. Room had a small foyer with closet and dresser and mirror. Large bathroom. Very clean bathroom. Water pressure in shower extremely strong!!!! Room had dishes, glassware and silverware for 2, small fridge, microwave, coffeemaker with coffee, sugar. Salt and pepper. Small bar sink with towel. Some shelving at efficiency set up. Very nice and well used by us. Room had a flat screen TV in a armoire with more side shelving on both sides for storage. Desk with chair and lamp. Also had 2 additional lamps and bedside/sofa-side tables. Also, club level lounge. It had coffee, tea, hot chocolate, hot water, tables and chairs to sit, eat, relax. We brought our lunch up there on a warm, sunny day. The doors to outside deck were open. Very nice. Useful and quiet. Saw a few people working on their laptops here also. Also had a wine and cheese hour from 4-5pm which looked to be well attended. Small gym on club level floor. Stayed here Nov. 3-8. Great location. One block to cable cars. Bus stop outside. One block to the heart of Union Square. Cafes, restaurants very close, same block or one to two block walk. Plenty of stores for shoppers. Lots to do in San Francisco. Hotel very well priced considering its location, room size, amenities, etc. Very nice room to come back to at the end of a day of sightseeing. Would very definitely stay here again. Highly recommend this hotel. Our first visit to San Francisco. Loved the city. Loved the hotel. Only suggestion. Request a higher level floor to be away from sounds of the jazz music in the 2nd floor restaurant if you prefer quiet. Our room on 9th floor was just right for us.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate/Convenient”
Reviews.Author: sunnylatte
Reviews.Content: I picked the Donatello based on the great reviews this website, as well as the great rate I got. I think the reviews are a tad generous, I had higher expectations. It is in a decent location and the staff were extremely friendly and very helpful. The room was spacious, but the bathroom and decor were a bit worn/old but clean. The bed was comfortable. The microwave and mini fridge were a nice bonus in addition to the coffee maker. I didn't check out the fitness area or any other part of the hotel, so I am not sure what that was like. I just needed a place conveniently located and relatively safe area, but reasonably priced, since I only stayed 1 night. I was on the 6th floor, and I could hear traffic and the cable cars (Powell is a block away) at night. But , the location is very close to Union Square so it is a trade off. If you are light sleeper bring earplugs or get a higher floor. There is a computer you can use in the lobby , but there is only 1. So I had to wait to use it, but I think there is free wi fi if you have brought own laptop.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice-will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: alcintorr
Reviews.Content: The Donatello is perfectly located one block from from Union Square, so you're surrounded by amazing shopping, restaurants and cable car stops. The hotel staff was wonderful-helpful with maps, umbrellas, cabs-anything we needed was provided quickly and pleasantly! The room was very large-my husband and I shared the king size bed, while my daughter slept on the pull out sofa bed, and we had plenty of room to maneuver. An excellent experience all around.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful room with great location”
Reviews.Author: artymom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Donatello for 2 nights and we were very pleased with the friendly and informative staff, great spacious room and wonderful location. On the club floor there is coffee, tea and comfortable seating to relax. It was a wonderful perk and a great way to start our day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: tierella
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived the staff were helpful and willing to answer any questions. We were delighted at being able to get into our room early. The room was compact but well equipped and very comfortable. The access to a lounge with complimentary warm beverages and an alternative place to sit and read/talk etc was brilliant. Located just one block from Union Square the location could not be better. Our children (aged 5 and 7) loved the spa and donuts for breakfast! I had requested a quiet room on a higher floor and this was provided. We will definitely stay here agin and recommend this hotel for all visitors to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Good”
Reviews.Author: tahoemark
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Donatello many times. The first was when we got engaged back in 1988! The staff is always great and seem to love their jobs. Rooms are comfortable, clean and have a frig, micro and sink that makes snacking easy. The hotel is a real bargain considering the quality of the rooms and staff and the location.

Reviews.Title: “Knee Deep in the Hoopla”
Reviews.Author: WilliamHWilliam
Reviews.Content: The Donatello is located in a great part of San Francisco, very close to Union Square, the cable cars, and China Town. A great deal of energy flows through this area, as well as the accompanying noise. So think of yourself as being part of a daily performance art exhibit including laughing, yelling people, honks, bus brakes and bums. It's quieter during the work week but spikes on the weekends. For the most part, it was invigorating. However, when you want to 'turn it off', the huge single-pane windows can only hold back so much - although they do partially compensate by opening a crack to let in the brisk air. It can be especially rancorous when the beer bottles start to fly or your neighbor uses the powerful plumbing (Mgmt: try looking into some hammer arresters). If you can deal with the hubbub, you will be treated with a nicely sized room with all of the necessities but not much in the way of trendy furniture (or calming color choices - unless you are a Bears or Gators fan). Beds are just to my liking - not too hard and not too soft. Yes, there is an icebox, safe, and wet bar. As you will typically find in this great city, service is great and friendly. Getting to your room is always a snap w/ two quick elevators and short hallways. For the money, you probably can't beat it, but it's not for the overly picky or sensitive tourist set that shouldn't be despoiling the city anyways. If you are traveling from the Fatherland w/ Bosha and can't figure out that a cable car is not your personal taxi: please stick to South Beach - they're waiting for you.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: HulaGirl58
Reviews.Content: There were 21 family members from Hawaii attending my son's wedding in San Fran and we had a very enjoyable stay at the Donatello Hotel. The entire staff were very friendly and helpful. The Front Desk & Bell men greeted us every morning as we were on our way to enjoy the city and told us to have a nice day. The rooms were very spacious and clean. The location was excellent, just one block from Union Square and 3 blocks from the cable car turnaround and Bart station. Lots of eating places close by as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location--Helpful and Friendly Staff--Large and Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: DNewk
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Donatello for the American Academy of Ophthalmology. The location in Union Square is great, and the property is fantstic. Upon checking in, I noticed my cell phone had run down its charge and realized I forgot to pack the charger--sure enough the front desk had a spare and gave me free use for the few days I was there. The 5th floor room was huge and clean and even had a nice courtyard area with a table in the back. The front desk staff always had a smile and a hello when I came and went and really made me feel welcomed. I would certainly stay there again. The concierge even set me up with a rental (just two block away) so I could drive to Yosemite for the day. In the general area, two restaurants that I enjoyed--the Daily Grill--is a pub type atmosphere with a nice menu and was perfect for dining alone and Farallon was a nice seafood restaurant with one-of-a-kind decor...

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel and good value”
Reviews.Author: miriIsrael
Reviews.Content: A very good location , a large room that fits also to more than 2 people. The staff is very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: AlexCowBoy
Reviews.Content: After reading all the very positive reviews, we expected a little more of this hotel. All in all it is average, however the location could not be any better.

Reviews.Title: “Superb place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JAMESSURREYUK_9
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, helpful friendly staff, clean greatsized rooms with everything you need and amazing value for money

Reviews.Title: “nice, great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: G6p6742m11
Reviews.Content: Considering the quality and location of this hotel, for the price (~$160/night) this is really great value. Rooms are spacious and comfortable. Very close to BART, for those coming from the airport, and right near the 30 bus (Exploratorium, Ghirardhelli, City Lights bookstore, North Beach, Chinatown, etc.). Also quite close to Dotty's True Blue Cafe, which was excellent for breakfast (went on a Friday morning, 1 hour from getting in line to being served our food - weekends are probably much worse). The desk staff was very helpful and friendly. My only complaint was that our second night there, as we were getting ready for bed around 11pm, someone started insistently knocking on our door and then, when we didn't immediately answer, tried to come in (although they couldn't because we had used the additional locks). When I peered out, there was a hotel employee asking me if the room was clean. WTF? First, yes, it was, and second, why the hell would anyone ask this at 11pm? Are there maids on call then? And who would want a maid in their room at 11pm anyway? When we checked out we told the desk clerk about this, and she noted it and said they would investigate. As far as I can tell, this was just one stupid employee in an otherwise very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we'd hoped for after reading Trip Advisor”
Reviews.Author: mikethemouse
Reviews.Content: Title says it all really :) 1 block from Union square and Cable Cars and about 10 min leisurely walk to Moscone conference center. Breakfast no longer free but excellent value for 7USD per person. Free use of Jacuzzi, sauna and Gym. Rooftop garden with nice lounge and free tea, coffee etc. Rooms are BIG and beds HUGE equipped with microwave, coffee maker, fridge and basic kitchen stuff (knives, corkscrew etc). Friendly knowledgeable staff. Parking is a bit pricey (Valet service 28USD) but if you're a guest you have unlimited In/Out privileges during the 24 hrs. Good for kids - great location. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant”
Reviews.Author: samm_2009
Reviews.Content: Its a beautiful hotel right in the heart of the shopping center, easy walking distance to the cable car and restaurants etc.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn82
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights at the end of our trip to San Francisco. Upon arrival, the staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was clean and very spacious and had a comfortable bed, large flat screen TV and dvd player. The hotel also offers complimentary wi-fi and tea and coffee on the top floor. The only downside really was that the room was quite noisy. We were on the 11th floor, but could still hear the traffic on the street below. The only reason we give this hotel 4 stars is that we also stayed at the Parc 55 hotel on the same trip and found this to be a better hotel in a better location.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay once again.”
Reviews.Author: mizzzmarie
Reviews.Content: My mother, two young children, and I stayed at the Donatello on 10/11/09. I attended a Shell Vacations owners' update meeting, so I had already stayed my two nights (10/09-10/10) at another hotel in Fisherman's Wharf. I wanted to extend the weekedn trip, so I decided to use my Shell Vacations points for the Donatello. We stayed at the Donatello in August, and our stay was great once again. Everybody at the front desk is super friendly and helpful, and they made us feel very welcome to be back again. The only thing that was different, was that there was no free continenatl breakfast anymore. My family and I enjoyed the breakfast so much in August, but they did not have it anymore. I guess they are trying to save on food and beverage costs (?). But overall, the hotel was still wonderful, and we will definitely be returning again soon!

Reviews.Title: “You will not be disappointed when you select the Donatello Hotel in San Francisco.”
Reviews.Author: Carola36
Reviews.Content: I have a time share at the Donatello but I have also used the hotel if rooms come available when there is nothing available with my time share. The bar is a hot spot and they have happy hour every night. The bar tenders are gracious and knowledgable. Not a large bar but comfortable. They often have live music. Every person connected with my stay go out of their way to make you feel wanted and at home. The bell staff give you the impression that it is not just a job but a profession! One of my favorites has been employed there for 17 years. The location is excellent--a block from the Geary and Curran Theatres--a block from Union Square which is surrounded by many major shopping venues. It has been awhile since I have dined at the restaurant but I hear the food is great. On Friday nights there is a wine tasting reception with an array of goodies. The rooms are clean and sparkle. The ammenities are exceptional. It also has a fully equiped exercise area and a spa. The only negative is that the parking is not included. It's my home in the City.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay near Union Square”
Reviews.Author: Kaminj
Reviews.Content: The Donatello Hotel is a great place to stay when visiting San Francisco. It is located a block from Union Square and within walking distance of Chinatown and Knob Hill. The rooms are clean and spacious and include a kitchen area with microwave. We enjoyed shopping in Union Square and visiting the restaurants in the area. We also spent several afternoons enjoying the walking tours sponsored by City Guides, it is a great way to learn about the city and get some exercise at the same time. The hotel has a happy hour every day at 4:00 featuring half price appetizers and low priced drinks, it was a great place to relax after the walking tours.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT WILL STAY AGAIN AND AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: tvsev
Reviews.Content: great hotel - location, rooms large and very clean. staff a pleasure to deal with will stay again and again excellent breakfast, fine resturant tvsev

Reviews.Title: “A perfect destination”
Reviews.Author: FlorabelleVacaville
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Donatello exceeded our expectations. The location was right in the center of art galleries, fine restaurants, major theaters, and close to transportation that took us to all parts of the city. The room was quiet and spacious as well as clean. The beds were comfortable. Advice from the front desk was extremely helpful in getting directions and obtaining theater tickets. The breakfast in the restaurant bar was certainly adequate and effcient. We enjoyed being at the center of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargin For a 4 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HeatwaveFresnoCa
Reviews.Content: We found the Donatello to be Clean and well taken care of. The staff there was always at our service and friendly. We found the location to be perfect for all our needs. It is close to China town, Union Square, And several Resturants. Most of our shopping and sight seeing could be done by walking just a few blocks,eliminating fighting traffic or taxi fares.

Reviews.Title: “CENTRAL, COMFORTABLE BUT DECOR STUCK IN THE 'SEVENTIES”
Reviews.Author: Brenda111
Reviews.Content: The Donatello is rather gloomy inside, very much stuck in the 'seventies and not the 'boutique hotel' I had seen it described as! However, the double room we had was HUGE with mirrors all over the place, sofa, plenty of wardrobe space and a massive bed. A little dingy - not dirty but could do with a facelift... Comfortable and VERY central, just off Union Square. Not hideously expensive for the position and I'd recommend it for a short stay (we were there 3 nights).

Reviews.Title: “Unique and comfortable hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: klgawor
Reviews.Content: This was our third time staying at the Donatello. As always the service was great although we did not enjoy the concierge trying to get us to go to a time share talk! No thank you, I'm on vacation! Other than that there was no issues. The rooms have a very unique color palate of royal blue and orange but its very comfortable and plenty of room. A great bonus is that each room comes with a partial kitchen including dishes, mini fridge, microwave, toaster, sink and towels. It was a great money saver to make our own breakfast every morning. This hotel also has a great location in union square, its just a few blocks to the cable cars and lots of shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for location”
Reviews.Author: Kapman
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a Bay Area trip, which included a couple of nights in SF, at The Donatello. For our purposes you could not ask for a better location. Along with adequate rooms; reasonably priced parking and very courteous and helpful staff', we thought the hotel provided good value. A couple of nits however...the complimentary breakfast as noted on their website no longer exists. If you choose to partake what is essentially continental breakfast (with a few packages of instant oatmeal and hard boiled eggs thrown in), you will be charged $7/person. We did not, when we looked at the spread. Next, when I took a shower upon my arrival, the tub was so clogged, I was up to my ankles in water. While an engineer came to repair it immediately, you would think that someone from the housekeeping staff might have noticed prior to a new check in. All that said, we would probably return if we had similar needs.

Reviews.Title: “Generally good but a couple of problems”
Reviews.Author: Skiranger
Reviews.Content: Good location in town, decent sized rooms and pretty helpful staff. However, having two separate companies promoting their services at reception and the club level was a little weird. Rooms were OK, but not great. Cheap cutlery and questionable decor. The bed spread in particular did not look very clean. The breakfast was OK if you got there early enough. However, our biggest problem was the location of the room. Our room was on the first level of accommodation, near the end of the hallway above a banquet room. Traffic noise wasn't a problem for us, but the room was also accessible through our window via the flat roof of the banquet room, so security was a concern if we left our window open. The plumbing in this particular room was also very loud with pipes creaking and waking us up every night. The staff tried to identify the problem, but weren't able to sort if out while we were there. Overall the hotel was OK but not good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: olchju
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with a great location. The hotel was clean and personnel helpful and friendly. A bit of noise during the evening/night but nothing to complain very much about unless you are sensitive to noise. What made the hotel GREAT was the location just a few minutes walk from the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent downtown S.F. hotel”
Reviews.Author: artlover78
Reviews.Content: The location of The Donatello at Post and Mason is as close as you can get to the downtown shopping scene in the city. The rooms are very nice, there are usable amenities, and the staff are pleasant and helpful. The in-and- out parking is very convenient. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise.”
Reviews.Author: tompy9
Reviews.Content: My permanence at the Donatello was very pleasant. I was expecting a decent Hotel , instead I found an upscale place with excellent service. Rooms in San Francisco are usually small with lower ceiling. My room at the Donatello was large , pleasantly set up , with high ceiling and large windows. For sure, next time in San Fran , I'll visit this hotel. And by the way, right in the middle of the shopping!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: angelansaul
Reviews.Content: Great Location! We walked everywhere and/or took the local transportation. The hotel staff was very nice and very helpful. We loved the feel of the botique hotel. The beds were comfortable and the rooms nice and clean. We would stay here again and again! The only problem we encountered was at a breakfast place on Taylor street and cross street O'farrell. I had my wallet taken out of my purse while I was sitting at the table. I was lucky enough to catch the the thief........but the breakfast place (Which was labeled "best breakfast in town, Zagat award" did ABSOLUTELY NOTHING! Didn't offer to call the cops, didn't offer to kick the thief out. ( The thief got scared and got her food to go after I caught her and retrieved my wallet back.) Didn't comp our breakfast. Other than that, WE LOVE SAN FRAN AND THE SERVICE IN MOST AREAS! THE DONATELLO IS AWESOME!

Reviews.Title: “Escape from Reality”
Reviews.Author: RPBILL
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by the doorman who not only escorted us from the car to our spacious room, but introduced us to the clerk who efficiently registered us in moments. Later the concierge effortlessly attained for us a Saturday night reservation at a local restaurant. Our getaway weekend to the City by the Bay was enhanced by our stay at the Donatello.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service, good value”
Reviews.Author: frodo33
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights after leaving the Columbus Motor Inn because of a noisy room. The customer service is superb but the hotel itself is showing it's wear and tear. When we got to the room there was black mold all along the tub. The staff quickly took care of this and to my satisfaction immediately when notified. They offer wine tasting on Friday's which is nice and have coffee, tea, and hot chocolate available at your leisure. It is right by Union Square which is great because you have access to many restaurants and shopping establishments within walking distance. Also nearby are many homeless individuals hanging out in the streets but overall we felt safe. I am grateful to The Donatello because they were able to accomodate us when we had to make a last minute reservation after the problems we had at Columbus Motor Inn. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION FRIENDLY STAFF”
Reviews.Author: EILEEN H
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights at this hotel. The reception was very friendly. The bedroom was large and very clean. Towels and linen changed every day. Continental breakfast was also provided and was very good. Plenty of toast, pastries, cereals, tea and coffee. The hotel has a great location being only two minutes from Union Square and transport. Would recommend this hotel for the short stay visitor.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and good value in a central location”
Reviews.Author: AndrewJ_UK
Reviews.Content: We used the Donatello for three nights, on arrival from UK and whilst waiting to pick up an RV. I chose this hotel on the basis of comments by other guests on TripAdvisor and was not disappointed. The staff on Reception were very friendly and happy to give advice on getting the best out of our short stay. The bedroom was huge (as was the bathroom) and had a kitchenette of sink, microwave, fridge and coffee maker. The on-line rate seemed excellent value, as it included continental breakfast. this has recently been improved - it is now served on the mezzanine floor alongside the restaurant, so there is a better supply of fruit, cereal and savouries to supplement the pastries and coffee. The hotel is just one block from Union Square, which reduces the noise, and a short walk (even with wheeled cases) from the BART and the cable car terminus. A good location for sight-seeing, as you can go north to Fisherman's Wharf on the cable car and then come back via the trams along the coast.

Reviews.Title: “the Donatello is excellent”
Reviews.Author: LittleRockMixx
Reviews.Content: we had the presidential suite since there were 3 of us. the staff extends every extra courtesy and the location is right in the middle of everything. we didn't get on the roof deck b/c it was windy, but that would have been even better. i recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with exceptional customer service”
Reviews.Author: walk2000
Reviews.Content: I, along with my family, recently had the pleasure of staying at the Donatello. I was impressed with the hotel even before I arrived. My phone calls to the hotel prior to my arrival were quickly answered. The staff was knowledgeable and helpful. They even remembered that I had previously called. Although we arrived prior to the 3pm check-in time, we were well cared for. The bell captain was there to take our bags and we were checked in. We were called when the rooms became available. The hotel itself is well situated, a block from the cable cars and close to stores and restaurants. Convenient parking is available, both at the hotel and a near-by lot with in and out privileges at a reasonable cost. The rooms are spacious and inviting, with high ceilings and windows that open. I especially enjoyed the roof-top lounge, with fireplace and inside and outside seating, a great place for that first or last coffee of the day. Another great service at this hotel: printed directions to help you navigate San Franciso.T There are many wonderful things at the Donatello, but what impressed me the most was their welcoming staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and great location!”
Reviews.Author: towsonbees
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to SF. The Donatello was in a great central location to use public transportion for where we wanted to go. The room was very clean and comfortable. The free continental breakfast was also a big plus for choosing this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I''ll stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: muskietto
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Perfect location in uinion square, place with lots of shops and very plent of vitality. Near the cablecar line, near Powell street station. The staff is incredibly welcoming, polite and willing to help you in every kind of problem. The room and bathroom are very spacious, clean, comfortable with some forniture to eat (microwave, cup of glasses, mug, forks, spoons, toaster, etc.). Plus I hate the hotel with only the moquet on the floor because of my allergy for the dust, but here the floor of the hall is made with a beautiful marble. I appreciate it.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: mountaindriver1
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at the Donatello we were treated like honored guests by the parking attendant, bellman and front desk receptionist. Because it was our wedding anniversary, we were treated to a complimentary bottle of wine and chocolates. Our room was spacious and, as requested, on a higher floor off the street to escape the city noises. The funky furnishings were pleasant and very functional, with lots of storage space. The mini kitchen was very handy for snackers like us. The club room on the top floor was a lovely place to sit and talk. The continental breakfast in the restaurant was very adequate and like us, we saw that most people had vouchers and didn't have to pay the normal $7 charge. The only negatives were some peeling paint on the bottom of our bathroom door, discolored grout around the tub that didn't look clean even if it was, and a loose faucet in the mini bar. But I considered those minor for a great hotel at the right price in the heart of the action where you could walk everywhere. We even walked to the pier for the Alcatraz Ferry. Would I stay at the Donatello again? You Bet!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and conveniences”
Reviews.Author: HappyTailsEdmonton
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel. The king size bed was great and fold out large and comfortable. The mini kitchen was very handy. As far as location it's great to be in the Union Square area which gives you great access to all the transit, cable cars, great shopping etc.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, efficient service; great location; large rooms; windows that open--who could ask for more?”
Reviews.Author: mrsent
Reviews.Content: Our group of nine adults gets together annually. Because this year was our 50th wedding anniversary, we got to pick the venue. Knowing how pictures can "lie," I visited at least two dozen hotels around Union Square in San Francisco and was delighted that the Donatello was within our price range. The standard rooms are larger than any others in the nearby hotels--and the windows open, a real plus for me. From booking through checkout, service from everyone was friendly and efficient. The rooms are equipped with a microwave, fridge, and basic dishware. Friday afternoon wine and cheese was augumented during our stay with appetizers from a local restaurant; we had an enjoyable hour socializing with other guests. The free continental breakfast (which apparently was not everyone's favorite) has been replaced by a self-serve buffet ($7/person added to your bill) at the Zingari restaurant bar (accessible by hotel elevator). I'm unclear about the relationship between the restaurant and the hotel, but would recommend the restaurant as well. My husband and I have eaten there many times and never had less than good to excellent food and service. This time they were even willing to provide us with separate checks (a must at these reunions). We had rooms on the 8th, 9th, and 10th floors and had no complaints about noise. Our rooms faced Mason St.; rooms facing Post might be noisier. The hotel is in the center of a major city, after all, so it's not going to be as quiet as a wilderness. The hotel is a resort, but I asked that we not be given a sales pitch. That was not our purpose for getting together. Information about the properties is in each room.

Reviews.Title: “Great & reasonable hotel just off Union Square”
Reviews.Author: jolly3
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights here getting reacquainted with the city after a 30 year absence. The room & the service were perfect with every amenity one could want; including a robe, microwave, fridge, the daily newspaper under your door and even a chocolate left when your bed was turned down for the night! There is a $7.00 charge now for the continental breakfast which I would skip and instead hit one of the many spots in the Union Square area that serve breakfast for not much more than this price. Free coffee, tea etc. is available all day in the top floor lounge and rooms have coffee makers as well. Would definitely stay at the Donatello again.

Reviews.Title: “This was perfect”
Reviews.Author: geneseo
Reviews.Content: The staff were excellent throughout the hotel great happy hour with good food and drinks there is a small spa upstairs on the club level-not very exciting-but it is there if you want it this is a great location,walking distance to almost everything recommendations for restaurants near by were very good,try Fino-great italian this will be our San Francisco hotel for all future trips

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - Loved It!!”
Reviews.Author: spunkygonecountry
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Donatello for about 5 nights while touring San Francisco. The staff are friendly and it's a excellent location near union square. Staff are helpful in locating attractions and booking activities (see Sarah at the front desk). Breakfast isn't worth a look (only fruit and pastries IF you get there early - we got there at 7am). The beds are comfortable though and all in all as everyone says the location is what sells it. Tip: Friday afternoon complimentary wine and cheese is a timeshare sales pitch, don't waste your time if you aren't interested in buying timeshare.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff and great Union Square location”
Reviews.Author: DougAndRobyn
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days at the Donatello and loved it. A block or so from Union Square with tons of very good restaurants within walking distance. Staff, from front desk to bellmen to maids were all very friendly and helpful. Parking is $28 per day, so don't take a car - cable car and trolley car are both walking distance away. Large room with small refrigerator and microwave. Very comfortable bedding and flat screen TV. The restaurant in the hotel is pricey (as most San Francisco restaurants are), but very good food (and excellent service). We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: UkGlobetrotter66
Reviews.Content: rooms very clean, friendly helpful staff, great location, I just think it is a little over priced, considering you have to pay for parking, we had to have 2 rooms for a party of 5. Breakfast was OK but not fab, on the day we checked out they were moving the breakfast area to the restaurant . you had a much better selection and more places to sit, an extra $7 per person. I would use this hotel again if there were only 4 of us.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value for money”
Reviews.Author: Xabbu
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in The Donatello in San Francisco. I choose this hotel mostly because of the good reviews and my high expectations have been excelled. The location is just amazing. It is near Union Square and from there you can get everywhere using the MUNI system. We walked to the The Embarcadero and even this was a very pleasant and not too long walk. The hotel is modern clean and the rooms are huge. And best of all it was a real bargain (just shop around online and you should find amazingly low prices). I would highly recommend this hotel, if you want to stay in San Francisco. I didn't find any shortcomings and I don't think that you can find a better package for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Would love to come back every year !”
Reviews.Author: justpeachywpg
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to San Francisco and we had no idea what to expect. But we were thrilled and excited and impressed with everything we saw and experienced. The hotel was perfect and the staff was very helpful and friendly. Great location. We walked up Market Street to the Embarcadero and along there to Fisherman's Wharf. A long walk but we are used to that and thoroughly enjoyed it. Another day, we rented a car and drove down the Pacific Coast to Monterey and Carmel. Absolutely beautiful. We were able to park the car for the night at the hotel for a very reasonable charge. We also rented bikes and biked across the Golden Gate Bridge to Sausalito. Another really fun day. Far too much to do in just one trip. We'll have to come back and continue. Zero complaints from us.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, great value”
Reviews.Author: mixers
Reviews.Content: There are lots of positive reviews of this centrally located 4 star hotel in San Francisco and here's another one. Booked via internet site and also confirmed on the phone and got a good deal Â£ 119 + tax for a studio room with king size bed and very large sofa bed. Room large by San Francisco standards (with smallish bathroom which was well equipped). Good city views from room and also from Club level at top of building where free hot drinks are available and there is a spa, sauna and fitness room. Staff all very friendly and helpful with good concierge service for booking restaurants etc. Location on Post Street and Mason is good, although Mason down to Market Street has its fair share of rather tacky tourist restaurants and stores. Stayed two nights and would happily have stayed longer to enjoy this great city.

Reviews.Title: “Great first time for the kids to see the great sights and sounds of San Francisco!”
Reviews.Author: gwendw
Reviews.Content: Our kids are 9 & 7-years and we thought that they were old enough to appreciate the sights of this great city. Staying at the Donatello was a great experience and central to sights either walking or driving. Included in the price was parking (free in and out) which helped tremendously. The hotel amenities and room were superb. All in all a wonderful experience and looking foward to another visit to the Bay Area!

Reviews.Title: “We can't fault the Donatello”
Reviews.Author: BMLNewZealand
Reviews.Content: Booked the Donatello directly on their own website, we were doing a driving trip so had a rental car, and parking was important. We didn't want to pay as much to park the car, as the hotel room. We got the parking package, which included unlimited in-and-out valet parking. All the staff we had contact with were fantastic, very enthusiastic and helpful, and clearly enjoyed their jobs. The rooms was very spacious, and having the mini kitchen (complete with salt and pepper, cutlery, crockery, coffee machine, microwave and frig) was a real bonus. It's not often you stay in a hotel with a large couch and an easy chair in a studio room. And the bed was oh, so comfy. Great location, only one block from Union Square. Will definitely go back when we next holiday in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, large comfortable room and excellent location!!”
Reviews.Author: fromsandiegoSanDiego
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our 3 nites at the Donatello. The hotel staff was excellent, the room was large and had a fridge and microwave, utensils and plates. We usually stay out on Lombard but decided to try this hotel and it was a great choice. We will definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - great hotel”
Reviews.Author: rushmill
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Donatello for one week this summer. Travelled with 3 teenagers - had two rooms. Chose this property based on reviews on this site and was not disappointed. Rooms were large(even with pull out couch open) clean and well furnished. Beds were very comfy. Housekeeping was good, extra towels left automatically, no need to ask. Turn down service is a nice touch. Location is wonderful: near everything and a great variety of restaurants within walking distance. Hotel restaurant was very good as well. Exercise area small and equipment limited. Computer in lobby area nice touch but internet access was unbearably slow. Concierge was able to help us print our boarding passes for return flight. Area for continental breakfast is small. Hotel was changing over to a breakfast in the restaurant area to accomodate crowding and limited selection complaints. Seemed that there would be a fee associted with this. ($7) Did not check out this new choice, but you may want to clarify if you are expecting a free continental breakfast Used valet service daily. Car was always brought promptly. Days when the parkers were busy and car took another minute or two, valets always acknowledged and apologized for delays. Would return to this propoert without hesitation

Reviews.Title: “San Francisco Treat”
Reviews.Author: GeminiDragonSanDiego
Reviews.Content: I always enjoy the location of the Donatello Hotel as well as the courtesy of the staff. I arrived early and to my delight was allowed access to my room; that was a treat as I had driven up from San Diego with my son in his truck. I was too tired to wait for the restaurant to open but the bar menu and happy hour drinks quickly had me feeling relaxed and comfortable. The next day the fun began as I explored the City from what is such an easy location to come and go from. This is my second time staying at the Donatello and I will be coming back again real soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, friendly staff, great accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Heinz38
Reviews.Content: My husband and I own Shell Vacations Club timeshare points at the Donatello and use it for "cooling off" when our summers in the Sacramento Valley heat up. We love this place because the staff is extremely friendly and curteous and requests for extras are always met promptly. The location, one block off Union Square, is ideal for everthing, shopping, restaurants, theaters, you name it. The accommodations are very nice and include a small "wet bar" and microwave, comfortable sofa and chair. Enough said.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED it!”
Reviews.Author: BabyBecca
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently stayed at the Donatello and we can't say enough nice things about it. It was our first time to San Francisco and we booked the resort through Shell Vacations Club. (We are members.) The hotel is centrally located within walking distance of Union Square and Chinatown and within a 10 minute driving distance of Lombard Street, the Wharf and the Golden Gate Bridge. The room and the hotel were lovely. The room was tastefully decorated with nice colors and a number of windows, a large bed and a pullout couch. There was also a mini-kitchen in the room, with a microwave, small refridge, a sink, plates, cups and utinsels. The hotel staff was exceptional, - the valet, the concierge, the front desk employees, the cleaning crew, EVERYONE - were extremely nice and very helpful. I would recommend this hotel/resort to my family and friends. It was a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: jemCalifornia
Reviews.Content: The staff is superb and the location is the best, one block to Union Square and close to the BART station. The breakfast is wonderful and the complimentary wine and cheese on Friday is GREAT!! Love to visit again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Terrific Experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tadju
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked and until we left, this hotel made us feel welcome, comfortable, cared for and as if we were long-time gracious friends. It started with the Desk Clerk who checked us in and continued until the Bell Captain hailed a cab for us at departure. Our room was spacious. It provided a most comfortable bed as well as ample room to read and relax. The wet bar, microwave and refrigerator enabled us to snack in the room and have a glass of chilled wine before dinner. We were fortunate to have a room with a landscaped terrace. The roof-top club, which provided a Continental Breakfast daily was convenient and casual. Full concierge services were also available there as well as in the lobby. Knowledgeable staff provide terrific recommendations and guidence. Not to be forgotten, the hotel is convenient to theaters and to all that the Union Square area offers. The restaurant, which is adjacent to, but not part of the hotel was excellent. We enjoyed two first rate meals that, for San Francisco, were well priced. Their bar had an almost "Cheers-like" atmosphere. Very pleasant --- and they mixed an outstanding drink. We'll say it again . . . our stay at the Donatello provided us with a Totally Terrific Experience!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and very heplful staff”
Reviews.Author: Ruthe95
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough good things about our stay at the Donatello. The location is absolutely perfect. Every mode of transportation is within a few blocks walk. Our room was well taken care of with turn down bed service every evening with our little chocolate goodies. Every concierge at the hotel was so knowledgeable and you never felt hurried. I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Another great trip to SFO”
Reviews.Author: CanadianTraveller200
Reviews.Content: There are a number of great places to stay in SFO but being in close proximity to Union Square is important to be close to the action and all the great dining. The Donatello Hotel in SFO is in a great location being one block removed from the square so a little bit away from the crowds and trolley cars but close enough you can be anywhere in the downtown within 10-15 minutes. The facility is well appointed and the rooms are nicely appointed and very spacious. Overall a great place to stay in SFO to be near the many activities and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place to stay in San Francisco.”
Reviews.Author: JoanTraveler
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Donatello several time. Medium-size hotel with great ambience and overall comfort. Staff try to make you feel you are their honored guests. One block from Union Square, close to cable cars, art galleries. If you want to purchase pastries at the Club Room be sure to go before 9 a.m.!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Donatello resort”
Reviews.Author: judelvis
Reviews.Content: Aloha, i checked in late and was treated wonderfully, all my request were met. I loved the rooms, very cozy and so close to union square, cable cars, bart. Found the restaurants room service excellent, the spa and exercise room very nice as well as the business center adequate. The staff was wonderful, from the front desk to housekeeping, and the valets. Everyone should be sure to go all the way down power street and go into the shooping center to find a fantastic grocery store, with lots of goodies. also restaurant with resonable priced menus...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: ant9801
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is in a great location and the service was excellent, we stayed in the presidential suite which required a little work. The bathrooms need a redo, including the plumbing fixtures. The second bedroom had a mildew odor. Everyone was very pleasant except one concierge was not as knowledgeable as she could have been. All in all a verygood choice.

Reviews.Title: “Finally a comfortable Bed!!”
Reviews.Author: phood_phanatic
Reviews.Content: This is the first night after many nights sleeping in rock hard hotel beds that could have passed for doors, that I finally got a good night sleep. The room was very clean, updated, with a cool view of the city below.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff and a great location.”
Reviews.Author: shllyljhnsn
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night and everything was great. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was quiet, clean and comfortable. The location is only one block from Union Square. This was a shopping trip and all of the stores were within walking distance. We took the Cable Car down to Pier 39 and enjoyed an excellent dinner. We will be back to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Union Sq & Bart Station. Very helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: RugbyFanatic
Reviews.Content: Located quite close to Union Square, the Bart Station and other forms of transport and restaurants. It was our first destination in the USA and were so happy with our choice, we stayed there again on our stopover on the home. While the decor not our personal choice, it was elegant and well maintained. The mini-kitchenette was a useful, non standard feature in hotels in the USA/Canada. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The Friday afternoon gathering for guests a very nice feature.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel at a wonderful price.”
Reviews.Author: lsassy
Reviews.Content: 4 of us recently stayed at the Donatello in S.F. I thought this hotel was a real gem. The price was good especially for the local and the wonderful amenities. This boutique style hotel has very comfortable and spacious rooms and bathrooms. The king size bed was a treat with its high thread count sheets. The breakfasts were good and served in their attractive club/terrace area. The staff was courteous and helpful. I like that it was smaller size hotel -not with hundreds of rooms. The best stay of our 10 day vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Central location. Excellent friendly service.”
Reviews.Author: Adrienne_9
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in the Donatello recently. The location is central - very convenient to Union Sq shops and city transport. Front desk and concierge were pleasant and helpful. We had to move room as a batchelor party arrived to 2 rooms opposite our original room. Our request to move room was dealt with quickly and effeciently without any fuss. The rooms are a good size and were spotlessly clean. One area that could be improved was breakfast- very sweet cakes, a plain option would be good. Nice club / lounge with city views, where you can read or enjoy complimentary tea or coffee. I would certainly return there again if travelling to San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great price, great location”
Reviews.Author: TFE
Reviews.Content: The Donatello is located near Union Square (shopping district) and Powell Street station, making it easy to get to public transportation. Chinatown is an easy walk from the hotel. We really enjoyed our 5-night stay here. The room was very spacious, with a nice layout that made it comfortable for us and our two 18+ children to share the room. Bed was great, towels were very nice and the room was very clean. Wireless Internet connection was very good. We had a refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker with a sink in the kitchen area, and there were dishes, silverware, glasses provided. The hotel staff couldn't have been nicer or more helpful. The only negative was that the plumbing was a bit noisy. However, it was certainly tolerable, and the hotel was a great value. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Every Minute”
Reviews.Author: KGD'sMOM
Reviews.Content: All the good things said about this property are true, you could not meet a nicer group of people. Every employee we met was efficient and service oriented. We had a fifth floor terrace room and actually got to enjoy it a few days. I was concerned about noise after reading some other reviews and I am happy to say that other than emergency vehicles we never heard a thing. The so called breakfast is really only good for the beverages and the fruit, but the hot drinks available 24hours were greatly appreciated at the end of the day when I was freezing. It was only in the high 50's during the day and windy, so by the time evening came I was ready for some warmth. We spent alot of time in the Wharf area doing tours etc, so I thought maybe staying in that area would have been a better idea. Now that I think about it it was good to take the public transit to see other areas of the city and we had some great food around the hotel. Biscuits and Blues is next door to the hotel, good food and a great Blues show. I would definitely recommend this hotel for a service and value oriented stay.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: likeeat
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the great reviews it received on tripadvisor, and we were not disappointed one bit. The location is within walking distance of many restaurants, shops, and means of public transportation. The staff are friendly, courteous, and extremely helpful. Special kudos to Sarah, the concierge! The room was clean and bright, and the price is quite reasonable for downtown in a major city. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A great base for our San Francisco vacation”
Reviews.Author: Steeler_Pens_fan
Reviews.Content: The Donatello has a lot going for it. It is in an area near to Union Square and the transit hub. The staff were all friendly and willing to go out of their way to make your stay enjoyable. The room was a good size and very clean. The continental breakfast was very nice but sometimes the area got a little too crowded. The only negative I can mention was the poor ventilation in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay for a perfect vacation”
Reviews.Author: lovetheview24
Reviews.Content: We traveled with our two older teenage children and they had their own room which was a vacation within a vacation. I've been to San Francisco 4 times and this was my best stay yet. Yes it was a little noisy, but it's a city. If I wanted quiet I would have gone to the country. The location was fantastic. One block from the trolley and the bus. Great restaurants within walking distance. The room was large, bright and airy. The bathroom was large enough and everything was spotless. The beds were very comfortable and according to my children, so was the sleeper sofa. The staff was incredibly helpful. We didn't eat the breakfast because as I said, we traveled with teenagers who think waking up at 10am. is early and really, I'm in San Francisco, why would I eat a continental hotel breakfast anyway. Just the fact that it was included in the room price is pretty unusual for a hotel in a major city. My only complaint were the pillows. There could have been a few more and much firmer. Overall, it was a fantastic vacation at a wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room - Things could be better though!”
Reviews.Author: Halefamilyof6
Reviews.Content: Pros: *Spacious Room *Fridge, toaster, microwave, coffee pot - VERY convenient!! *Good Storage *Clean!! *Excellent location to Union Square and shopping *concierge VERY helpful - asked if we wanted to listen to a timeshare pitch BUT was NOT pushy when we said no. *Besides credit card issue (see below), the staff were all VERY friendly and happy to answer any questions. *Sound wasn't an issue - I mean, yes, you can hear traffic below, but I'm really not sure you can avoid that in SF and it wasn't as bad as some other hotels we've stayed at before. Cons: *HORRIBLE shower - felt like I was in a pressure washer for a shower. *breakfast - coffee, tea, OJ and pastries. A couple baby apples and a few oranges in a bowl. Ours included the breakfast but there was also a sign that said a charge of $4 - for free I can't knock it - but if you want more than muffins or donuts, it's not going to happen. *Internet only worked some of the time in the room. Have to go to the club level to get good service. *Issue with credit card - each person we spoke to told us a different thing that was being held for incidentals/room charges...very confusing, and we stay in hotels A LOT and have never had such a bizarre experience. Overall - would we stay here again? Maybe. We're still waiting for the credit card issues to be worked out, I guess it depends if things are really resolved. If they are, probably - I can chalk up the issue to just a glitch or misunderstanding or mistake. If not, I'd try somewhere else - there are so many hotels in the City to try.

Reviews.Title: “Room out dated”
Reviews.Author: Lever8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with our teenage son booked the" Presidential Suite" . It was large, like an apartment, with a dining room and a living room, but no kitchen, two large bedrooms and two baths. The decor was very out dated, but comfortable. The bathrooms were very small, dingy and seemed like they didn't belong, in proportion to the rest of the suite, more like they belonged in motel six. The towels were substandarderd,as were the shampoos and soaps. It should have been a great room, but really needed up-dating!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've been to in San Francisco.”
Reviews.Author: HoustonCatwoman
Reviews.Content: I have been to numerous Hotels in San Francisco including some of the very pricey hotels located directly in Union Square, and this hotel was by far the nicest. It is really a great deal. The rooms are very modern,clean, and spacious. The bed was very comfortable. I slept very well. There is also a sofa bed that some members of our party slept on, and they said that was pretty comfortable as well. The windows are large, so the view is good. There is also a refrigerator, microwave, toaster, and coffee machine in the room. The front desk staff members are very friendly. It location is just a couple of blocks from Union Square. There is also a Walgreens nearby in case you need anything in a rush. I read reviews on this hotel before I booked it, and some complain about noise. Well, San Francisco is always noisy. It is a city so there is always something going on, and there are always sirens. There is a nightclub across the street from the hotel which does have a little bit of noise but it is not really noticeable or unbearable. I'd say that the room was pretty quiet compared to rooms I've stayed in elsewhere. The only negative is that the continental breakfast is $4.00 for 2 pastries and a fruit. However, one can't really complain when the rooms are so wonderful for such a great price. And they do offer free hot chocolate, coffee, and tea which is great. GREAT GREAT GREAT HOTEL! Our stay was very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room - But a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: sunluvva
Reviews.Content: ROOM 502: Large bed. Cool room. Small bath. Steamy mirror. Poor shower. No shower gel. Coffee machine available (no tea), plus fridge, microwave and toaster. Big TV. Poor lighting. Noisy city at night. SERVICES: Conceirge extremely helpful with booking tours. Breakfast choice was poor as well as the crowded seating area. AREA: Cable cars are slow with huge queues. Bus tours available (until 5pm) to Fishermans Wharf then on to Alcatraz and access towards Golden Gate Bridge. Sonoma wine country tour is worthwhile. I WOULD RECOMMEND STAYING IN A HOTEL NEAR FISHERMAN'S WHARF.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Ballyhack5
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Donatello for 4 nights at the start of a holiday in California. A great hotel, good sized rooms, friendly staff and good value. Within easy walking distance of Union Square. I would certanly have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Times”
Reviews.Author: darav3
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was wonderful and had a great sense of humor! We were contacted by the concierge within a few hours of checking, they wanted to find out how they could help us during our stay. It was located in a central area and close to so much. The rooms felt welcoming and comfortable. We had enough room for my sister-in-law to drop in and spend the night. The bathrooms show the hotels age but were clean and well stocked. I did like that we were provided a bathrobe. We only were there two nights and it was quite a nice stay. The continental breakfast was light but there. I loved that there was FREE wireless internet in the rooms! Though the 30 some odd dollars for parking was no fun the hotel was close enough to walk to get public transit so we did not have to pay more for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location,friendly staff,large room with full kitchen”
Reviews.Author: iarak
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel, near Union Square,easy to get to any kind of shops and restaurants. Big room with kitchen allowed us to have meals with a lot of confort! In the top floor we enjoyed a nice room with magazines, soft drinks and juices (free). Spotless clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great room; helpful friendly staff; and good rates”
Reviews.Author: fn820
Reviews.Content: 5 night stay with the family to attend a conference. Everything in the room worked as it should; the bed and the pullout were comfortable; and there was plenty of shelving and storage space for our assorted gear. Our room looked almost exactly like the one on their website. Breakfast room is very relaxing but get there early or the best fruits will be gone. It even a wrap-around balcony for the hard-core smokers.... We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Sized Room - Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: MikeC52
Reviews.Content: We stayed three weeknights in The Donatello on family vacation with two teenagers. The room was great size for the four of us. We read the tips on the pullout couch and was semi-worried going in - but it was perfect! The room rate was reasonable and the location is the best - Union Square. So much walkable and accessible nearby. The service was top notch and front desk very helpful and friendly. The only knock was the workout room - very subpar. One treadmill and bike won't cut it at a major hotel property. Did find an outstanding three mile run downtown through Union Square area - excellent! The breakfast area was also crowded and was confusing if it was complimentary or you needed to pay. Didn't matter as two of the best breakfast places are very close and walkable - Dottie's and Crepes. Overall - very favorable stay and would recommend to friends!

Reviews.Title: “Great value in the greatest city!”
Reviews.Author: ckori
Reviews.Content: Close to Union Square shopping and the China Town culture, the Donatello Hotel is a great value in San Francisco! A good restaurant, Happy Hour, piano music in the Lobby and a knowledgeable, exceptional staff! Won't stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room with a great mattress”
Reviews.Author: Chimago
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights in the Donatello recently and I highly recommend it. The room was tastefully decorated and comfortable with a nice sofa,table and lounge chair. The mattress was really comfortable. I have a Sleep Number Bed at home so I am very particular. I slept very well. I especially liked that I could open the window to the outside and enjoy the cool San Francisco night. The hotel is in walking distance of several restaurants if you choose to not partake in the hotel's,(I did not). Upscale shopping is very near in Union Square. Close to BART and public transportation. I will return to the Donatello. The staff was welcoming and housekeeping was very friendly. A very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: ktingirl
Reviews.Content: Our two day stay at the Donatello in Union Square was wonderful. Chinatown was just a few blocks away as were two of the cable car routes. We enjoyed walking around and found wonderful places to eat and drink. The staff were very helpful and our room was located on a quiet side street so we could rest well in the afternoon and evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great C0mbination of price, service and amenities”
Reviews.Author: estates4sale
Reviews.Content: My wife and i make regular treks to SF for a change of pace and have tried out dozens of hotels over the years. The Don fits us best. One block to Union Square, nice clean room with everything you expect but hardly ever get ... comfy king-sized bed (better than home!), clean room with nice furnishings, flat screen, dvd player, a little boom box, fridge, safe, coffee machine or Club room in the am for complimentary coffee, parking for 20 bucks if you ask for the combo package. What else? Little stuff like a robe, ironing board, hair dryer, queen-sized pull out. And the windows open, at least in our room, so you don't feel like you're in a hermetically sealed cage. And the service was top rate. We're going back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for a cozy/romantic getaway!”
Reviews.Author: PaulRehob
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I have stayed at The Donatello several times and enjoy its excellent central location in Union Square, within walking distance to the Starlite Night Club, several varieties of restaurants, trolley service etc. etc. The hotel's 2nd floor bar & lounge is very cozy/romantic with jazz singer & pianist to complete the setting. Hotel staff have always been very service oriented and no problem with the cozy, clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Our special place”
Reviews.Author: honeymooner52
Reviews.Content: Five years ago we spent our honeymoon at the Donatello and fell in love with it. Since we live in Sacramento, we use it for our get away place to the city. We've found our favorite restaurants within walking distance. The staff is always pleasant. The lounge on the top floor is always a comfortable spot to go. After a nite at the theatre or Giants game we love to go to the 2nd floor lounge for a drink and some pleasant live music.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel. Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: barsu
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as Shell Vacation members. Their customer service is excellent. The front desk and bell caption service was very helpful. Room service was great with very good prices. Dinner at the Italian Restaurant at the hotel was 1st class. We will definitely stay here again. Location was perfect to take public transportation anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable and enjoyable stay with great top-floor Concierges!”
Reviews.Author: JonathanSymonds
Reviews.Content: I spent 9 comfortable days at the Donatello while my partner was in SF at a conference, and found the rooms spacious and comfortable. They look somewhat dated, but one warms to that, and the convenience of having the space and a fridge and kitchen area is appreciated. Breakfast was limited but pleasant, not least for the opportunity to chat and pick the brains of the wonderful concierges - Poldi and Peter. They were a mine of information, and have extensive files of the same to hand to assist you in your sight-seeing and restaurant booking! Don't bother with the hotel restaurant - very average - go across the road to Fino's for good Italian food! (And don't forget the 'Cheesecake Factory' at Macey's - what a find!).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff...”
Reviews.Author: Heatherpdx
Reviews.Content: We thought this was a fantastic hotel. We really enjoyed the Friday night wine tasting.. The staff was very helpful in offering tips on navigating the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and with friendly staff and comfortable rooms.”
Reviews.Author: omegamoon2000
Reviews.Content: The Donatello for the most part met my expectations during my five night stay. After researching sites like Trip Advisor and finding an excellent rate at this hotel, I decided to give the Donatello a try. The rooms were quite large with ample space to spread out. The queen-sized bed was comfortable. I was fortunate enough to get a corner room and experienced minimal hallway traffic and noise. The room's layout and cleanliness were good but the quality of furniture and lighting seemed below average for this level of hotel class. Since I was on the fifth floor, there was also a fair amount of street noise. The bathroom was a pleasant surprise with a convenient layout, plenty of counter top space and clean towels. Overall feeling of cleanliness was extremely high similar to what one can find at a five or six star hotel. The continental breakfast was basic but good. Sliced bread, bagels, donuts and pastries and fresh fruit were available. Coffee was quite good and served hot. Every morning, the tiny breakfast room and outside deck areas were crowded with as many guests as it can hold. The fitness center is across from the breakfast room and small with one treadmill, cycling machine and some free weights. The Donatello is little more than one block away from Union Square and about five blocks from the trolley car station. During the day, the area around the hotel seems to be relatively safe. Many nights walking back to the hotel was uneventful with a decent amount of people and cars still going through the area. Most memorable was the friendliness of the hotel staff. They were very approachable and helpful and keen on making your stay a pleasant one. Overall the service was highly commendable with generously-sized and comfortable rooms.
