There was a limited view of high-rise buildings from our room â€“ as youâ€™d expect in the city centre. Also, there is a very popular night club just across the road, so there was some noise in the early hours as people were leaving. There are some other lively bars and a few nice restaurants in the area - although it is mainly a shopping location. The hotelâ€™s piano bar is pleasant, and offers very reasonably-priced drinks. The Donatello proved a good value deal in the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: 2Maine
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from a week in California. We stayed 3 nights at The Donatello in San Francisco. We found the hotel to be a good choice for us. The room was extremely nice; large and well equipped. There was a wine and cheese party the afternoon we arrived (Friday) which is a once-a-week event. This took place on the top floor where the complimentary continental breakfast was offered every morning. Staff was very friendly and helpful, as other reviewers have noted. Housekeeping standards were high. The location, while convenient to Union Square, public transportation, etc., was sort of on the fringe, and you didn't want to wander too far or you'd be in a pretty seedy area.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty faultless”
Reviews.Author: FandJRocket3
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel. It's quite large and very centrally located being a stone's throw from Union Square. But it's not too large and impersonal. The staff were helpful and geuninely interested in giving us a good time (we stayed two nights) and managed to remember our names and where we came from during conversation over consecutive days we gave all of the right impressions. Out room was quite well appointed with a wet bar and microwave oven and a very large, very comfortable bed but - in all fairness - wasn't overly cute or romantic. But then that wasn't really it's brief. We wanted a fairly central, quite businesslike hotel with location and facilities more important than 'soul' and that's what we got, with personal service and a degree of attention to detail thrown in for good measure. Worth a revisit.

Reviews.Title: “There must be two Donatellos in SF”
Reviews.Author: conchalito
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Donatello hotel for 4 nights in October 2008. We chose it based on the the reviews in TripAdvisor. I am really amazed to re-read some of the comments that people have made, now that I have been at the hotel. What are they talking about? Is there another hotel Donatello in SF? This is a nice hotel? A nice lobby? There is hardly any lobby at the hotel and it is as simple as your can imagine. People who wrote that must have been sitting in the the lobby of the JW Marriott across the street and not the Donatello. As far as the beautiful rooms, maybe we just got unlucky and got a bad room but we checked other rooms from outside while the doors were opened for cleaning and they all looked basically the same. I have lived in SF for many years so I know the area and was not surprised by all the beggars and other bad and ugly elements that show up, mostly late at night, in that area. What I did not expect was to stay in such a disgusting room with paint peeling and mildew. The people at the reception are very nice but were totally ineffective. We arrived at the hotel two hours before the check-in time. Jesus, who somebody recommended for a review and a raise, and maybe he deserves it, welcomed us and checked us in. He took our mobile number and said that he will try to have us checked in as soon as possible and will call us when the room is ready. We never received the call and upon our return to the hotel we found out that the room was ready but that they forgot to call us - no big deal. What was a concern to us was the fact that the concierge could not find our luggage. It took him several minutes to realize that his colleague has left them in a conference room near the lobby - the door to that room was unlocked and anybody could have entered the room and take the luggage from there. With our hearts still pounding we took the elevator (dirty and in need of renovation) to the ninth floor. Our room was away from the street, which is highly recommended in this area, with a view of a car rental place and some other shady hotels and apartments in the same block - just next to the ice-maker and the door to the maintenance room - not such a big deal unless you want to sleep late in the morning. The worse part was the bathroom - SEE some pics attached. I called the "effective" and nice people at the reception and asked to speak to the manager. "no problem - he will get back to you very soon". I called 3 times and left 3 messages and I never received a call back from the manager. I can go on with other examples of how ineffective the staff is â€“ but nice â€“ but all I can say is that I will never stay there again, not even for free.

Reviews.Title: “The great combination of value, comfort, service and location”
Reviews.Author: aorrdalca
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week at the Donatello, a clean, spacious and well-located hotel very close to Union Square. Our room was perhaps twice the size of a standard city room, and considerably less expensive. With the friendly service, included continental breakfasts and internet access, it's difficult to imagine how the Donatello could do things better. We'd happily return.

Reviews.Title: “I Absolutely Loved the Donatello”
Reviews.Author: futurebruin2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Donatello Hotel for our recent trip to San Francisco California and let me tell you, It has to be one of the BEST hotels I have ever stayed in. The staff there was EXTREMELY nice, and had some of the best if not THE BEST customer service ever. They greet you with smiles on their faces and are so polite, they genuinely do make you feel very welcome. Anytime we needed something, we would call housekeeping and we would have someone knocking on our door in literally less than 5 minutes. They are so attentive and will help you in any way. They're just great. I am planning to go back to San Francisco very soon, and will definitely plan on staying at the Donatello hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “I will stay at the Donatello again”
Reviews.Author: ShaluKalu
Reviews.Content: The rooms at the Donatello are comfortable, practical, and attractive. The staff is helpful and pleasant. Breakfast is a buffet continental repast--the room gets crowded but the food is quite fresh. I was there for 12 nights and don't have a single criticism of the hotel, except for the crowded breakfast room. The restaurant attached to the hotel, however, is quite mediocre and very noisy, with unresponsive staff. Avoid it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice renovation Great Suite”
Reviews.Author: JLudlm
Reviews.Content: I have been frequenting this hotel on and off for the last few years but have been missing since the renovation of the "presidential suite" which I booked for a week-end with my wife. Although the tenderloin with its usual mix of bohemians and bums remains near and unchanged (the Hotel is one block from Union Square Shopping and the Theater District) I enjoyed seeing again the same faces (Miguel the parking attendant is becoming an icon) and enjoyed the friendly atmosphere of the hotel . The check-in was a bit slow but I enjoyed my free apple while waiting. The elevators are also a bit slow but adequate most of the times. The suite was completely renovated, the living room and dining room now have polished wood floors and the living rooms has an enormous (I think 50") plasma HD. Rugs adorn all the rooms and the walls look freshly painted. The decor doesn't match the rest of the hotel because they picked a classic "elegant" look with heavy draperies and antique prints on the wall but makes you feel at home and pampered. I guess they have not renovated the kitchen as it was locked and not available during my stay. All and all I had a great time and would reccomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms, nice service”
Reviews.Author: Torport
Reviews.Content: Great location, big room, very nice hotel staff and excellent rate! Everyone that works there was always very pleasant and curteous. It's just a block or two from Union Square which is great for shopping. Also very close to the BART. Fisherman's warf is a little further but not a bad walk (as long as you go along more flatter streets, like Kearny). During my stay in San Fran, I also stayed at the Hilton Financial District for 4 nights. I personally preferred the location of the Hilton only because I really liked Columbus street with all the Italian restaurant cafes. But overall, I felt the Donatello was a much better place to stay. Certainly not as poshy and trendy as the Hilton but very clean and nice and closer to more stuff to do. They also have a rooftop patio thing which is kind of cool (only went to see it, didn't really enjoy it much).

Reviews.Title: “Donatello Was Great”
Reviews.Author: ArubaPhoenix
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here 3 nights but I wish it could have been more. We arrived long before check in time but our room was ready and after flying from the East coast it was fabulous to get into our room. The room was large, great comfy bed and plenty of room. The hotel is also a timeshare so the guests probably stay longer and need the microwave, wet bar etc. I couldn't believe we got a smoking room in California (husband is a smoker - please no lectures) but the windows in the room could open so he would smoke right near the window so the room would be spared. No view to speak of but fresh air! The location right at Union Square was so convenient to everything. A continental brakfast is available on the club level and it was free with our room or is $4.00 - coffee, etc. fruit, danish bagels - more than enough for us. The bar - next to the restaurant is very nice and has an extended happy hour each day - very nice at the end of the day after walking the hills of San Francisco. I'd go back to the Donatello in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: keesboom
Reviews.Content: C.Schuddeboom, Lords Valley,PA. September 2008 The hotel is in a perfect location. One block from Union Square and 3 block for ChinaTown. The service was excellent. The hotel was clean ,bright and cozy. We had one of the seven terrace rooms and definitely worth trying for.The room was large,very comfortable and has A/C. Loved the wet bar,microwave,refrig,dishes,glasses and silverware.We celebrated our 25th wedding anniversary and , when told, the hotel sent up a bottle of wine and chocalates.Nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Had Everything We Needed”
Reviews.Author: galveston_gal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Donatello from October 8 through October 12. I booked the hotel on their website and paid from $159 (Wed., Thurs. through $199 (Sat.) for our stay. I found this to be a reasonable price judging from websites I checked prior to our trip. We stayed on the 8th floor close to the elevators and never once heard the sounds from anyone in the hall. There was a wall of windows fronting Post street, and we loved having the natural light with the curtains open. Perhaps we're heavy sleepers, but with the windows closed and the air on, we slept very well. One night that I left the windows open, I was disturbed by the trash collection going on early in the morning. We tried out the new jacuzzi in the workout area and had a great time. We were the only ones using the tub, and using a tip learned here on TripAdvisor, I set the timer on the womens' sauna before entering the jacuzzi so that the sauna would be nice and hot after our soak in the jacuzzi. Unfortunately for me, either I don't know how to use the sauna or it was broken. Either way, I was disappointed. My husband had a great 15 minutes in the mens' sauna and wanted to return every evening. We only had the free continental breakfast only once during our four night stay. It seemed to be very carb heavy with lots of donuts and bagels, and not what we normally have for breakfast so we decided to go out all other times. There are many diners, and coffee shops nearby in any direction. You will definitely find something to eat. I appreciated the free San Francisco Chronicle and US Today available, and also the coffee and tea available throughout the day. I would definitely recommend this property as a good middle of the road hotel with very large rooms in San Francisco. If you want to spend more money for luxury then you should do so. This is a nice property for under $200 per night in a wonderful location near Union Square and near all the cable car lines. I definitely give it an enthusiastic thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Just Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: USFlyerNewJersey
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights end of September into October. All requests were honored - no smoking, room in rear, and adjacent room next to other family members. Very efficient and courteous staff. Rooms were very large with small efficiency kitchen - refrigertor, microwave, sink, toaster, & coffee. Very clean and nicely furnished. Free Wi-fi connections and access to computer and printer in lobby. Location was perfect - only a couple of blocks to Union Square and near all transportation. Nice little walk into China town also. Hotel served a continental breakfast with bagels, croissants, and pastries and some fruit each morning in the roof top lounge which was plenty to get us started for the day of touring. Hotel also had a gym with sauna but unfortunately we never had time to use it. Hotel also has a nice restaurant and bar area which offers half-priced apertizers during "Happy Hour". Great hotel at a great price. I would highy recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service, great location”
Reviews.Author: BlackCoffee
Reviews.Content: A Block away from Union square at a reasonable price? I found it hard to believe.... but it was true. The Donatello is a comfortable hotel in a great location with a great staff. The Room was very clean and comfortable, with Microwave oven, toaster and fridge for storing small snacks. From our seventh floor room we could hear no road noise. Great selection of TV channels (No PPV).

Reviews.Title: “Donatello Rocks...”
Reviews.Author: Dreamdance
Reviews.Content: We just had a wonderful visit to San Fran which included 2 nights at the Donatello. What a great Boutique style hotel!!!! Our room was large and the bed was really nice. Reminded of our bed at home.. Location perfect a block from Union Square.. The staff was excellent and very helpful. Sarah the concierge hooked us up with a fabulous Italian restaurant "Fino" 2 blocks from the hotel. Fino is a small romantic place with nothing over 27$$$. The food and service were exceptional!!!! Great Combo...The Donatello & Fino

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: David E
Reviews.Content: 28Sep-4Oct08: CHECK-IN: We arrived at the hotel at about 2pm on Sunday and checked in quickly with no problems. Based on TA advice we requested, previous to our arrival, a room on the highest floor and on the backside of the hotel to get away from the noise. We were given room 1011 (Floors 12 & 14 are apparently VIP/expensive rooms). Our view was poor as expected, but with the AC on, we never heard any noise at night, and very little during the day. Loved it. After getting information on activities, we were given an offer to see Muir Woods free if we sit through an information spiel â€œupdating us on using our benefitsâ€�. No thanks! The ROOM was an ugly orange and blue as expected, but was spacious and comfortable with enough space to put away our clothes and â€œstuffâ€� with ease. 30â€�x 20â€� refrigerator, small microwave, toaster, coffee maker, condiments, a couple plates, cups and silverware; nice 34-36â€� widescreen TV, DVD player, mini music center; USA Today every morning with the San Francisco Chronicle available in the lobby. INTERNET: We used it everyday and never experienced any problems. The BATHROOM was a little smaller than expected. Only 5x8 including the tub/shower combo. The whole room is well planned, except for the waste of space across from the bathroom. If the room entrance had been moved from the center, the bathroom could have been at least 50% larger. The toilet flushed very loud. The BED was reasonably comfortable, but a little hard. We are spoiled with a foam mattress at home. We ended up putting the extra sofa sleeper sheets from the closet on top of the bedding/comforter, and then covering ourselves with the extra sheet and blankets. We then slept more comfortably. CONTINENTAL BREAKFAST: See pics - Reg & Nonfat milk/various coffees & teas/tasty OJ; good donuts/pastries/muffins; bananas/apples/oranges; bagels/cream cheese/butter/jams; Many TA folks have complained about the breakfast. Perhaps some do not understand that this is a classic continental breakfast â€“ not a buffet. Nonetheless, how hard is it to add little cereal boxes? And regardless of anything else, we are in the year 2008 and it is just very poor not to have yogurt, which is a staple of quick breakfasts today. If you get in there in the first hour, food selection is fine. After that, the selection diminishes quickly. The selection also seemed to diminish during the week from Monday to Thursday, but then Friday and Saturday were decent. Outside there were 2 tables with 4 & 2 chairs, and also 2 lounge chairs. With a light jacket it is very nice to enjoy your meal outside. Inside there are 4 cafÃ© tables with 3 chairs each, and also 4 sofa chairs and one sofa. Seating is hit and miss after about 7:30am. We ate there a couple of times, otherwise we just brought our food back to the room. FITNESS CENTER: Very minimal EQUIPMENT: 1 stair stepper, 1 stationary cycle, 1 treadmill, set of free weights; meager universal machine, scale and water dispenser. Small but adequate separate SAUNAS. You may need to turn it on and then wait 15 minutes or more for it to warm up as I did on all 3 occasions I used it. The aluminum JACUZZI is brand new and a bit small. The first time I could barely fit in with several other people in it. The next 2 occasions, there was never more than 1 other person. They have towels, locker room, showers etc. LOCATION IS EXCELLENT! Just a block from Union Square and 5 blocks from Powell and Market. You can get half-price tickets at TIX in Union Square for numerous plays, comedy clubs and entertainment venues. 1 block from Biscuits & Blues where we listened to some great blues. Ruby Skye club across the street. 1 1/2 blocks from Colibri Mexican Restaurant which was great. 1 1/2 blocks from the American Conservatory Theater which is a very nice theater where we saw â€œRock nâ€™ Rollâ€�. 1 1/2 blocks from the Curran Theater which was a decent theater in which we saw â€œSpring Awakeningâ€�. 1 Block from Honey Honey CafÃ© & Crepery which is great for a sandwich or burger and excellent for an omelet or a crepe. Innumerable eating, shopping and entertainment establishments very close by. MASSAGE 4 blocks from the Union Square Stress Reduction Center (on Sutter before Kearny) where we both got an excellent massage for $50 per hour â€“ if you donâ€™t want to spend a ridiculous $105 per hour at this hotel. If your calves hurt like ours, this was almost a necessity. IF YOU WALK places like we love to do, and you are here for more than a couple days, we highly suggest that you take the cable car or buses when going upward or downward. We both jog/walk a couple times a week. Nonetheless, walking up and down the hills now and then during our stay caused both of us significant and unusual discomfort in our legs and shins after a couple of days. We used the sauna and Jacuzzi only 3 times, but we needed to use it every single day. TRANSPORTATION: Unless you are traveling away from San Francisco, driving is completely unnecessary and probably frustrating. Public transportation is fun and inexpensive. The MUNI pass is only $24 for seven days. We highly recommend the City Pass for $59 which includes the 7-day MUNI pass and the $25 admission to the California Academy of Sciences (a MUST SEE!), a 1-hour bay cruise which is cool, and a few other good attractions. Last year we stayed at the Le Meridien Hotel on Battery Street near Embarcadero Plaza and Pier 1. It is a better hotel with a great location too. However, given a choice of the two at the same price, we would stay at the Donatello because the location is the best, and the free internet which we used to explore SF every day.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it”
Reviews.Author: Griznovski
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed in the Donatello in Sept 2008 and it was a great start to our California holiday. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the room was large, bright, clean and comfortable. Really god bed too, which is important to us. I used the gym a couple of times which is a little small but functional. Unlike some other reviewers, we didn't have any problems with noise from the street even though it was Friday and Saturday and we could see the entrance to a nightclub from our 15th floor window. The only negative is the breakfast. It's fine if you're happy with coffeee, croisants, bagels, fresh fruits and gooey gunky sweet muffins, but the breakfast room itself is very small and nowhere near able to seat all the guests who come in so most ended up taking their breakfasts to their rooms to eat. Again, fine if you don't mind doing that but something to be aware of. Location is very good and it seems quite critical. We popped over to look at the Hotel California which is only a couple of blocks away and one we were considering staying at. But those couple of blocks make a big difference. The neighbourhood takes a swift dive for the worse into a world of liquor stores and downbeat people hanging out on corners. Not exactly romantic. But the area immediately around the Donatello is fine. Overall then, a very nice hotel for the price and in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: lamalmc
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Donatello many times. All are stays have been very enjoyable. All the staff are great to deal with and the hotel itself is a very special place to spend an enjoyable weekend in San Francisco. This last say, I must give cudo's to bell man "Carlos". He helped out with a couple of special situations, beyond the call of duty. Thanks again, Lon McCasland Redding, Ca.

Reviews.Title: “Made a great stay in S.F. even greater!”
Reviews.Author: santafeterry
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at The Donatello and they will most certainly get my future business while in San Francisco. Great location, friendly & helpful staff and clean, quiet and beautifully decorated rooms. My wife and I arrived late on a Friday afternoon and after settling into our room, we relaxed on the concierge level & outdoor lounge area to totally enjoy the Friday wine & cheese party which is a tradition at The Donatello. What a way to start our vacation and set the mood for our relaxing and romantic stay in San Francisco! The Donatello provides all the subtle little touches that make your stay just that much more special--morning newspaper, a bowl of apples in the lobby for the guests, free continental breakfast, nightly turn-down service with chocolates on your pillow, access to a computer and, when it was discovered that I was celebrating a birthday during our stay, a gift of a bottle of wine and box of chocolates was sent to our room. The Donatello certainly contributed to the absolute enjoyment of our stay in San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Would Return to the Donetello”
Reviews.Author: TRIPMANHAWAII
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was very accommodating and answered any questions that i had; Location was in very good proximity of the Union Square; Room was clean and well kept.

Reviews.Title: “Frisco Find”
Reviews.Author: Travelsof2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Donatelo September 24 through 26 and it was excellent! The location of the Hotel is perfect for seeing the sites of San Francisco with out the hassle. Location Location !!. The room was great with all ammenities required including a fridge and micro, flat screen TV mini stereo, Even some dishes! Bathroomwas fine though small compared to some hotels but who needs a huge bath, We liked the fact that windows were huge and opened although our view was not post card quality it didn't matter. We had a king bed and it was very comfortable. Breakfast was so so as there is limited choice juice coffee pasteries and bagels. There was fruit but not as fresh as it could have been. If I can complain about anything its serving food on paper plates and cups. For a hotel of this quality its sub standard, Now I know its picky but I equate eating off paper to dragging your nails across a blackboard! The staff was over the top in helping answer all questions and providing direction and personal favorities for site seeing. There is a night club/restaurant although we did not eat there ( there are numerous places around the hotel) we did go to the club and enjoy the entertainment. On another note when in Frisco do get the 3-day Muni pass do not get the 7-day pass. Do ride all three cable cars. Do not try to catch the the Masson or Hyde line at the bottom of Powel. Do go to Macy's and catch the "F" street car go all the way to Garibaldi Park and ride the Hydye line back or get off at Fishermans wharf and ride the Mason line. Ride the Californiia line in the afternoon so the sun is at your back for pictures looking back to the financial district. Do stay at the Donatello its the best bang for the buck with class.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Great Accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: TravelinGal79
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently stayed at the Donatello in San Francisco for one night. Being that it was our first time to the city we were pleasantly surprised that our hotel researching paid off! The hotel was definitely a little gem, and the staff were above par with being extremely helpful and accommodating to us. The location was only a few blocks from Union Square and all of it's magnificent shopping! And right in the heart of San Francisco's exciting city. All of the hotel staff that we encountered were extremely nice and really made you feel at home and welcome. Thanks Donatello we will definitely stay with you the next time we are in the area!

Reviews.Title: “Donatello - Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: Marilyn42
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Donatello Sept. 14- 20 and we were very happy with our choice of hotel and glad we decided not to stay at Fisherman's Wharf. Hotel is in a good location and 5 mins. walk to the start of the Cable Car to get on at the beginning, and the F Line on Market Street which we used frequently. If you are returning from the waterfront, you get off at Post which is only one block away. Pleasantly surprised at the large size of the room and the amount of drawers and shelves (double closet with safe and 3 drawers at the entrance), also each side of the TV stand opens up to about five shelves. We unpacked completely as we were staying 6 nights and did not have to live out of our suitcase. There is a microwave, toaster, bar fridge, coffee maker, sink and glasses, plates and cutlery provided. Staff were extremely pleasant and helpful with any of our questions. Good continental breakfast included - excellent choice at 7:30 a.m., however by 9:00 a.m., it can be picked over. The coffee maker in the room makes one large coffee, but that wasn't a problem - I just went up each morning and brought two large cups down to the room from the Club Floor. Coffee is available 24 hrs. so if you sleep in, you miss the food but can still get coffee. We were on the street side (facing the Marriott Hotel) and it was somewhat noisy, but we are sound sleepers, and it didn't bother us. If you are a light sleeper, you may want to request a room not facing the street. Several very nice restaurants within walking distance and at all price levels. They have a few smoking rooms, and by contacting the hotel directly, we were able to be assigned a smoking room. For price and location, it is excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Traveller1310
Reviews.Content: Great hotel located just off Union Square. Staff were really friendly and helpful and the rooms were large, comfortable and well equipped. My only complaint would be that we were woken at 5.30am on the last morning of our stay by a staff member knocking on the door to deliver our final bill - no idea why they felt the need to do this, as we weren't checking out until 11am! Other than this, I wouldn't hesitate recommending a stay at the Donatello to anyone visiting San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “A well kept secret in the heart of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: GordonandMichael
Reviews.Content: The Donatello was the perfect place to begin our tour of the USA. Finding the hotel was no problem as it is a 5 minute walk from the Powell Street BART stop. 35 minutes from airport to hotel in total. Rooms were large and very comfortable. Staff were friendly, helpful and knowledgeable, and the happy hour in the bar was also very welcome and great value. The rate included a buffet breakfast which is served in the club room on the top floor overlooking the city. A walk to the Embarcadero and Pier 39 is 30 minutes away, so the Donatello is well located. Gordon and Michael

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: AbiV
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in San Francisco at the tail end of a trip through California, Arizona and Nevada. We booked a triple room for me, my husband and 15 year old son and we weren't disappointed by the size of our room, which included a massive queen size bed and a comfortable sofa bed and still had loads of room to spare. The room includes a "kitchen area", which has a microwave, fridge, sink and coffee maker, which was a great addition as we were pretty fed up of eating in restaurants by then. The location is good, just a block from Union Square and a cable car stop. We didn't use the leisure facilities on the Club Floor, although we were given a guided tour by the very friendly staff on duty and it looked fine. The breakfast was basic and limited, but it was complimentary, so no complaints! In general, the staff throughout the hotel were helpful and friendly, which seems to be the norm in San Francisco. We loved it and would definitely make a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Pinaki
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights. The cost of the stay was the same using various websites or the hotel's own site and cost $100 for a large room as we were travelling with our teenage daughter. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, including the night staff as we arrived very late after a flight from the UK. The hotel is just a few minutes from Union Square and close a variety of transport links around the city, including the cable car. The room was clean and comfortable. Continental breakfast was included with the price and there was a good selection of breads and pastries. However, if I were to have one complaint it would be that the breakfast room is very small and each morning there were not enough places for people to sit and eat. Many people just picked some things up and took it to their rooms. The coffee was also not always very hot. That being said, I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again if we visit San Francisco again. One piece of advice for anyone who is picking up a rental car from San Francisco - don't!. We used Alamo and the wait was four hours to get the pre-booked car (although they ran out of cars and we were upgraded). Hertz next door to the hotel also had an extremely long queue of people waiting to pick up a car at mid-day. This is apparently a common problem in the city during the summer. Next time I will pick up a car at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “~ Ãˆ bello!”
Reviews.Author: M&ALongGrove
Reviews.Content: We checked into The Donatello for 3 nights, August 20-22nd. The hotel is in a great San Francisco location: about 3 blocks from the Street Car turn-a-round on Powell St.; the same distance to the BART (Bay Area Rapid Transit) Powell stop; with Trolley Cars and Buses all nearby. Note: a BART ride to SFO (San Francisco International Airport) is 35 minutes, and costs $5.35 one-way. It is only a 7-minute walk to The Donatello. Nice! Also: the AVIS Rental Car Office is only 2 blocks away. Nice! About the hotel . . . Very well-maintained. Nice lobby. Nice front desk staff. Very courteous. Very helpful. Nice, spacious room. Not out-dated at all. Nicely furnished. Microwave. Fridge. Flat-screen TV. Clean, marble bath. Great shower. Small, but nice, exercise room on the Club Floor on 14. Nice lockers for men and women. Sauna. Spa pool. Clean. Well-done. Continental breakfast. One of the best that we have ever had. Anywhere. Fresh coffee. Juice. Rolls. Croissants. Fresh fruit. Well-stocked. Well-replenished. You won't walk away hungry. Negatives: Our room was on the 10th floor. The hotel had an air conditioning proplem on our first night. With the windows open, there was quite a bit of street noise. However, with the windows closed, no problem. And, this IS a city location, folks. Also: the breakfast, which is served on the Club Floor, can get very busy. Very busy. It is served from 7am to 9:30am. Finding a place to sit can be a challenge. An outdoor patio is also available with limited seating. Go for it!! That's it for our "negatives." No big deal, eh? Summary: The Donatello is a fine hotel, with very nice amenities, priced-right, with a first-class staff in a prime San Francisco location. You should not be disappointed booking The Donatello for a nice visit in one of our country's special cities. Gustare!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy Stay and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: lilacbirman13
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Donatello was very professional and friendly during our four night stay. We checked into room 915 which was considered a â€œquietâ€� room. I was afraid that our view would be the wall of another building but luckily we had a half way decent view of the Clift & Hilton hotels a block or two away. To the very left we could also see Ruby Skye nightclub which did get a bit noisy. Being a highly sensitive sleeper, my sound machine has saved me eight nights of noisy street sounds during our SF stay here and another hotel near the wharf area. The room was a good size for the city, the color scheme was very pleasant and furnishings were well done IMO. The room also has a fridge, toaster, microwave oven, cups, dishes and utensils. We were never approached about the time-share but we did bump into a few owners who seemed to really love it here. One couple had been there for three weeks! The bathroom was very clean but could use some updating such as the tub caulking in a few spots showed some "age spots". So if you are one of those people who is picky about such things, this lovely hotel might not be for you. My complaint is that the shower really sucked (can I use that word?); I felt like I was being shot at by a fire hose! I like a soothing shower after a long day and being shot at by a water canon like shower was VERY unpleasant. Oh, and the toilet flush is quite loud you can actually hear it next door, uh, only the flushing part though, lol. Other than that I would stay here again. Itâ€™s a great location, the staff welcomes you back each afternoon/evening and it was nice to be able to go to the club at the top floor to have coffee, tea or cocoa. The location is great and the price is pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Boutique Hotel in San Fran.”
Reviews.Author: GordonToulson
Reviews.Content: San Francisco was the last stage of our trip to California and we stayed at The Donatello from 19th to 24th April 2008. We chose it after studying many hotel reviews and were well pleased with our choice. The hotel has been refurbished in contemporary style. Our room was huge by city standards. We had a microwave, sink unit and tea making facilities. There was also a CD/DVD player and Hi-Fi system. Noise was minimal. The only loudness was the orange colour of the room decor ! A simple continental breakfast of bagels and croissants with preserves was served in the beautifully furnished 'club room' on the top floor. Being close to Market Street and the cable cars for transport and Union Square for dining proved to be big plus points for this hotel. Staff were very friendly and helpful. I would not hesitate to stay here again and recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Confort in SF”
Reviews.Author: Tzengia
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel placed a couple of blocks from Union Square. The room are big with microwave, coffe machine, toaster and refrigerator. We recomend it. Gianni + Ale Italy

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: Nick48
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to San Francisco. We stayed from Jun 27 to jul 3. Our experience was great in the Donatello. Very clean, excellent location, and very customer oriented staff. The hotel is at walking distance to the great union square and many shops, restaurants,bars and even a drug store. The room was clean, confortable, a/c (we never used), and not noisy as other members reported. The bed was great, nice pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Largest Rooms in SF”
Reviews.Author: NiceNYer
Reviews.Content: I join the chorus of admirers on TripAdvisor who recommend this hotel for its excellent location, large rooms, consistent service and undeniable value. Our very large, king-bedded room on a high floor featured a clean, small bath with marble surfaces and expectable amenities. We were told that it was on "Club Level," which may or may not indicate a premium room at a premium price. The bill was still under $200 per night for a last minute booking. Simple complimentary breakfast, helpful concierge, easy transfer by taxi to the airport--we really could not ask for anything more. It lacks the high drama of the Mariott's top-floor lounge, or the Hanging Gardens of Babylon inside the Hyatt's cavernous lobby. But it freed up several hundred dollars that went, instead, toward food, wine, flight and car-rental in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the center of the city”
Reviews.Author: EB190
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd trip to San Francisco, but our first stay at The Donatello. We stayed here on 05/21/08 & 05/22/08. We had a room on the 9th floor. The hotel staff was very friendly, courteous and helpful. Our room was very clean. The comforter on the bed was probably the heaviest one I have ever found in a hotel. Room was very bright and colorful. Entertainment center was equipped with a flat panel TV, DVD player and a stereo system. This is older hotel, but in pretty good condition. This hotel is also part of a time share company, which we did not know before hand. The A/C in our room worked, although it worked, it made a low rattling/vibration sound which was a little irritating. Ended up just opening the windows and letting air in at night. It was cool enough that this worked. Since the hotel is right in the middle of the city, there will noise outside all night long. This did not bother me, but did to my partner. Bathroom was OK, but had a great hand held shower attachment. The free continental breakfast left a lot to be desired. Consisted of bagels and doughnuts. No cereal, milk, or anything with protein. We ended up going out for breakfast each morning. Just down Mason St from the hotel there is a Loriâ€™s Diner & CafÃ© Mason. We ate at the CafÃ© Mason. Busy, but we got seated in just 5 minutes. Very good food. Very quaint restaurant. The hotel is located on the SW corner of Post St & Mason St. Entrance is on Mason St. Just one block up Post St to Union Square & the Powell cable cars. However, since this is just a short distance from where the cable car starts, they are usually completely full when they get to Post St. Suggest walking down Powell to Market and stand in line to catch the cable cars going towards Fishermanâ€™s Wharf.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Alanbab
Reviews.Content: We chose the Donatello based on the good reviews on Trip Advisor. We arrived at the hotel around 10.30am after disembarking from a cruise and had requested an early check-in. We were very impressed when the reception staff were clearly expecting us and our room was ready - excellent! The room was just as shown on the website, clean, spacious and very comfortable. The roof terrace is very nice and we made use of the simple continental breakfast which is complimentary. I must add that this area could get very crowded at breakfast but we were there at 7am and had no problems. The hotel is in an excellent location particularly for people who don't want to keep walking up hill to their hotel. We felt that the Donatello gives excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: Arilisanne
Reviews.Content: Nowadays it's tough to find a nice hotel with all the amenities in a big city for under $200 a night. Well, the Donatello exceeded all my expectations. The service was prompt, efficient, and friendly. Our room was spacious, very clean, and comfortable. The hotel provided all the services of the large chain, upscale hotels including concierge, bellmen, spa services, etc., but provided a free continental breakfast, free wifi, and free use of the fitness center -- most upscale hotels despite high room rates, also charge additional fees for such services. The only downside that I can think of to this place is that it is also a timeshare, so be wary of the "free wine and cheese reception" on Friday afternoons; it's more of a sales pitch to buy the timeshares. But we were not hassled at all. Also the fitness center is a tad anemic; just three cardio machines and one weight machine -- but like I said, it's free, and there are also men's and women's saunas and a co-ed jacuzzi (though that was out of service when I was there). It's just six blocks from a BART station, and in a great shopping neighborhood (Union Square) and close to Chinatown. Overall, a great stay and I'd recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Moses1971
Reviews.Content: We loved the Donatello. The staff was Great!!!!! Big and clean room. The room had a microwave and refigerator which really came in handy. The location was perfect. Very safe. Did I say the staff was Great!!!! The only complaint I had was the street noise on the weekend from the club across the street. We had brought ear plugs to be prepared and we slept fine. I would not think twice about staying there again and would recommend it. Make sure you get a top floor away from the club.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel ... Bad Tour experience”
Reviews.Author: two-to-go-08
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was Great, just don't book your tours through the concierge. We booked one that included Muir Woods and the Wine country. The concierge or hotel uses a tour company called Extranomical Adventusan Fransico. They sent an 8 passenger van and put 15 people in it. It was so bad, we had to get off and not take the tour. The tour company said no refunds because you have to cancel 72 hours in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: geoff1007
Reviews.Content: Super hotel. Biggest beds and great sized rooms. Really convenient - just a block from Union Square and bars/eateries.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Great Price.”
Reviews.Author: eblebebe
Reviews.Content: Check the hotel website for their Sunday night special. (The closer to the weekend, the lower the price gets as long as they have rooms.) We had a King Suite: King bed (very comfortable), sitting area (couch, chair), entertainment center and wet bar (sink, refrigerator, microwave,coffee maker, real cups and glasses, silverware...) Noise was NOT a problem on Sunday night. Very pleasant and helpful staff. Great location; Easy walking distance to Union Square, Curran Theatre, trolley & more - try Max's restaurant a short block away - more reasonable than the hotel's restaurant and great food (breakfast, lunch and dinner.) The ONLY negative is the decor - I'm talking UGLY! But clean and good quality - so turn out the lights and you have a 3+ star boutique hotel at 1-2 star prices! Beware the "stay & park" deal - we paid $5 more for parking on the package deal than if we had just gone to the hotel and paid the $28 per day parking. (Might want to call the hotel before booking and compare the package to the regular parking at the time.) Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “dont take a room over looking Post or Mason”
Reviews.Author: vickinca
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, as previous reviews staff are wonderful and very helpfull, breakfast also had orange juice, bagles (which you could toast) along with pastries, coffee and several types of tea. The biggest down fall the noise from Ruby Skye across the street started @ 11 pm until 2 am finally dozed off and then what I thought was the garbage truck @ 4am woke me up to smashing glass. After laying there for about 15 minutes I got up to take a look to see what the heck was going on but it was not the garbage truck making the noise it was people going through the garbage looking for cans and glass, yes garbage pickers going through the garbage looking for glass and cans and then throwing them into the back of the pick up truck. This went on until just after 5 am and it was loud and we where on the 7th floor corner room, got up to make sure all the windows where closed it was that loud. If the hotel could find a way to sound proof the windows this would resolve the noise issue. Second night (Saturday I slept with the pillow over by head which helped) so if you are a light sleeper like me do not take a room over looking this street ask to be moved right a way. This is the only issue we had, we didnt change rooms as we where only there for 3 nights in total, but now that we know this side of the hotel is loud, we will make sure not to take a room on this side of the street! Great location to everything will be posting a travel tip in the near future

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel of all I've visited”
Reviews.Author: pamsadventures
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was great, the staff was great, housekeeping was phenomenal, loved the convenience of hot beverages throughout the day, & noise was not a factor in our room. Enjoyed our stay immensely. We went to San Fran for my birthday, & per suggestions from other reviewers, I called the hotel to let them know that, & requested a room with a balcony. When I got there, I was pleasantly surprised to hear that they were able to honour my request (since there are only a few select rooms with balconies). Asides from the occassional police sirens, we did not hear any noise, perhaps because of the location of the room, & the fact that the weather was cool enough for us to sleep with the windows closed. I did not get a welcome pkg upon arriving, but they called a few days later for us to pick it up. We were too busy to pick it up, so I don't know what's in it. Also, despite other guest's comments, we were never bothered about attending timeshare. The breakfast was nothing special. I say you're better off buying some cereal & milk from Walgreens & eating that each morning than eating their sugary offerings. I am also puzzled @ how they would offer just orange juice, & not a choice of juices in the morning (my boyfriend & I can't have orange juice). I have a bad back, & don't usually like hotel beds, but their bed was only second to the sleep-number beds offered @ other hotels. The location is great, you don't need to rent a car, it is very close to everything. Housekeeping vacuumed, & very thoroughly cleaned our place every day. Even our dishes were washed! Turndown service everynight was lovely to come back to after a long & tiring day of sightseeing. It rained one night, & the hotel lent us an umbrella (just ask front desk) They even gave us a complimentary bottle of wine for my birthday. My boyfriend & I were also @ another hotel on this trip, but enjoyed the Donatello so much more! Tip: If you are an AAA member, check the website of the hotel direct before you book because I found booking direct with them using the AAA discount was cheaper than doing it through on-line travel sites. It was a wonderful hotel, but I guess it best to book with this hotel during low travel season so that you're less likely to get stuck with a bad room.

Reviews.Title: “Too noisy for rooms facing street, specially on week-ends”
Reviews.Author: FabiolaMiami
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel for three nights on April 23rd. The rooms are quite large and have the advantage of a small refrigerator with a sink and a microwave. Nevertheless, only two pillows were supplied and we had to ask for two more. The A/C was not very good but we were able to sleep with the windows closed. On the 3rd night, which was a Friday, we could not sleep at all, with all the street noise (even though we were on the 9th floor). Another couple traveling with us had an inside room and did not hear the noise. The Continental Breakfast was ok, but there are only 4-5 tables which are very rapidly occupied. The breakfast, although ends at 9:30 am, sometimes runs out of food by 9 am. Our valet parking was good, you would call 5 minutes prior to leaving and they had the car ready for you. Our "Welcome Package" was never presented to us upon registration, as they are supposed to do - only got a call two days later to have us pick it up - which we did not do. The staff is very friendly and warm. The proximity to Union Square and to Powell Street makes it very convenient for shopping and transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest Stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Stoutmaker
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have traveled to numerous locations throughout the US and Mexico. I have to say that The Donatello is the greatest hotel we have been to. The staff was excellent, especially the front desk and the concierge. I have read numerous reviews and want to dispel the rumor that it was "noisy". Yes there is a club across the street and maybe room location has something to do with it but we slept every night with the windows open and were not bothered one bit by the noise. We are returning to the Donatello in two weeks and would never think of staying any where else in San Fran!

Reviews.Title: “Very Noisy”
Reviews.Author: fireandrain
Reviews.Content: Despite reading a previous review about noise we took a chance. The hotel is very well located- a block from Union Square. The rooms are clean and freshly decorated. Everyone on staff was friendly and competent. Just one significant problem- the noise. We were on the 9th floor (too high to hear anything we thought?) About 10PM to midnight on both Friday and Saturday nights the noise below from the nighclub Ruby Skye sounded like a riot going on. The commotion in front of the club caused traffic problems. (Shouting, screaming, etc) And by the wee hours the clean-up crew would dump a load of empty bottles in the recycle bin about every 15 minutes. (CRASH)-I'd guess about 15 times. The real shame is other than the noise I would strongly recomment this hotel. If I were them I'd call the police to make a "disturbing the peace" complaint.

Reviews.Title: “We loved The Donatello Club”
Reviews.Author: NewHampshirePrincess
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Donatello during the week of St. Patricks Day,2008. The weather was sunny and of course a little chilly but we are from the NH so we thought it was great. We were very impressed with the Donatello. The staff was very friendly at all times. The food at the Restaurant on the 2nd floor was great and we very much enjoyed the delicious pastries, coffee and juice served upstairs in the Donatello Club level. Our room was clean, large, and the bed was so comfortable. The bathroom was marble tiles and the decor, reminicent of Italian style. The location was near to the shopping district at Union Sq and in a good area, not too hilly right there. They have a parking garage which we did not need, we used the public transportation,streetcars and the cable cars. Do the cable cars and ride on the outside standing up. It's fabulous! The Hertz rental car shop is right next door,very convienent!! We highly recommend The Donatello and would go back in a second!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel (Watch out for noise!)”
Reviews.Author: psprof
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel. We stayed 2 nights. From when we arrived, the hotel staff were amazingly helpful. The only big negative of this hotel is the noise outside. We asked for a quiet room and we could still hear the crowds clubbing across the street. It wasn't enough to keep us awake, but we can imagine in a room facing the street, it would be pretty bad. Ask for a room high up and away from the street (no view, but quieter). The restaurant food was also really good and we ate there twice. The wine and cheese tasting was no big deal, but the pent house lounge was nice to sit and relax, drink some tea, etc. There was no real "work space" or desk in the room, though, so finding space to use the free internet might be difficult at times. Just have to work from the bed. The inclusion of a little kitchenette and all the cable movie channels for free (no pay-per-view! What a concept!), though makes up for this minor deficiency. This really is a good 4 star hotel with 5 star service. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Donatello”
Reviews.Author: Goletti
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, staff were ever so friendly especially Jesus, it was our honeymoon and without thought we were upgraded and given a bottle of champagne. The only downside was that the rooms were a little tired but very clean, and if I'm honest you are only sleeping there as there is so much to do in San francisco. Definitely recommend staying there again - don't bother with breakfast though - a few danishes don't cut the mustard for me.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing and unorganized”
Reviews.Author: andrealv
Reviews.Content: If I have to summarize this hotel in one word it would be: UNORGANIZED! Maybe Iâ€™m a little jaded because I had such high expectations (and had read some great reveiws) and was disappointed from the very beginning. This hotel has some good qualities, but a few minor improvements here and there could make it a lot better. The bad: Dated rooms, poor communication and check in, questionable housekeeping The good: Good location, Lounge with coffee and tea, Free Wi-fi... The parts that made me sad: Before checking, I called to see if I could get some assistance, we were celebrating our anniversary and I wanted to get some ideas and restaurant listings. Well, I called several times and they kept transferring me to someone else, then someone else, and then leave a voicemail (and I did and was never called back), but that wasnâ€™t too big of a deal. We got to the hotel (after a very long trip and flight delay) about 15 minutes AFTER check in time, (which was perfect in my mind because I really wanted to check in and relax). When we got there, they said our room wasn't ready yet because the people who had been in the room previously had requested a late check out. So they proceeded to call housekeeping to have the room cleaned. They said our room would be ready in 15 minutes (is that all it takes to clean a room?); we could have a seat in the lobby or go up to the lounge on the 15th floor and have some coffee. We elected to go up to the lounge and they said they would send someone up with the keys. Well, over half an hour later, we were still waiting, so I asked the concierge in the lounge if they could check to see if our room was ready yet. The answer was, yes, it was almost ready, but we would have to go back downstairs to get our keys because the bellboy was busy. And please keep in mind that we were dragging our luggage around this whole time. And they didnâ€™t bother to apologize or thank us for waiting. So we finally got into our room. And I am usually a very happy person. I was NOT happy to be moved around back and forth because they failed to plan wellâ€¦They let someone else stay late and made us wait because of it. I have stayed in many hotels all over SF, and I appreciate and recognize the difficulties that come with antique buildings. I expected thin walls and even though we were on the 11th floor, we were able to hear traffic outside. This was expected. However, I was kind of surprised at the large gap at the bottom of our room door, it allowed quite a bit of light through (making it hard to sleep for me), but can be covered with a towel. The room showed its age, was not cleaned very well, as there were documents from the last guests left in our room. The couch was a lumpy looking nightmare; the cushions didnâ€™t seem to fit right. They seem to be pretty cheap here. A hotel booking website lists that they have free breakfast, but the â€œbreakfastâ€� is actually $4 for 1 glass of orange juice and 2 pastries. Spend your money elsewhere; there are tons of great restaurants in SF. The housekeeping staff left me somewhat puzzled day after day. On some days, we would receive replacement toiletries, some days we wouldnâ€™t. When we got there, there was only 1 bathrobe (for 2 people), but they were nice enough to bring another one at our request. But then on another day, they took both robes and didnâ€™t replace them. They even gave us a used shampoo on one day. The maid also came in when we had the â€œdo not disturbâ€� sign upâ€¦ She said she thought that we had left. Those were some unusual experiences for me, but I figure they were just oversights..? On a side note regarding housekeeping, I came across a coffee spill in the lobby that wasnâ€™t cleaned for 2 daysâ€¦ not too sure if they regularly look around and cleanâ€¦ And then 2 days after I checked out, they charged me $1 for a soda I didnâ€™t drink. When I called to ask about it, I got transferred 3 times and was told, "well, itâ€™s only $1" but she would ask to see IF they could refund it as a â€œcourtesyâ€�. I donâ€™t even drink soda. Itâ€™s not my fault if they miscounted something. I donâ€™t care about the dollar, but in the travel and hotel industry, I expect a different standard. The parts that made me happy: The concierge (both downstairs and upstairs) were friendly and seemed willing to help. Wi-fi in the room, as well as a computer in the lobby for guest use was nice. This hotel is in a pretty good location, very close to Union Square (but you are in SF; so there will be beggars anywhere you go), the lounge upstairs has some nice views. The lounge also has coffee, tea and hot chocolate all day. This was a small little perk that I really liked, especially considering the cold weather. They also have umbrellas in the room in case it rains. The rooms are a nice size for SF. The safe in the room was big enough for our laptop! New TVâ€™sâ€¦There are a lot of nice things about this hotel, but they need to tighten some of their employee and organization issues.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Donatello!”
Reviews.Author: Citprof
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights over the President's Day weekend & just loved the Donatello!! I was there on a RCI exchange. The staff just couldn't have been friendlier or more helpful! The lobby concierge Shari was so great, felt like we were old pals by the time I left. Room was huge! The Club level was really nice to get a cup of tea & it would've been nice to sit outside when the weather was nicer. There was a great little cafe across the street (think it was La Tezza), lots of yummy fresh food, soup was killer! The refrigerator & microwave in the room, along with the kitchen amenities made it easy to skip restaurants. Tip: go to the ferry building & get some wonderful cheese, sourdough, & some wine & have your own little feast. The Donatello has a GREAT location & easy to get to transportation...BUT make sure you buy your Muni pass at the airport, then take the BART in to Montgomery Station & walk straight down Post Street to the hotel, about 5 easy blocks. DON'T get off at Powell Street, especially dragging luggage, crowded, crazy people, and some folks begging. Always go straight down Post to Montgomery/Market, then you can catch the underground Muni to the Embarcadero & the ferry building, or catch the F-Market, the old streetcars that will take you all along Fisherman's Wharf.--although it was an easy walk down Market to the ferry building too. There are taxis right across the street from the Donatello if you need one too, fare was about $6 to the ferry building (I was running late for my Napa tour) and fare was about $9 from the end of fisherman's wharf by the Maritime Museum (my feet just couldn't take anymore walking/standing!) Although do venture down Powell to the beginning of the cable car route, fun way to see different neighborhoods & heck, you have to if you're in San Francisco!! 8-) Tip: Get a Muni pass at the airport, it will be good for the underground Muni, street cars, buses, and even the cable cars. The Underground Muni is not the same as BART, even though they share terminals, BART is the train you can take in from the airport, RT to Montgomery was $10.70 My fav. travel book: Dummies Guide to San Francisco, gave me all kinds of great tips! Great tour to Napa: [-] Wonderful guide, Orion & nice ferry ride back (then you can pick up the cheese & sourdough at the ferry building!)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: ChicoStateMom
Reviews.Content: We booked the Donatello because our timeshare company has a portion of rooms there. The location just 2 blocks off Union Square is perfect to wander and sightsee in SF. The room was clean, spacious and well appointed. Some details could have been updated but they were minor. The small kitchenette was nice, frig/microwave/coffemaker and dishware to get us through leftovers or appetizers. The breakfast/lounge area was nice, though we didn't have anything but coffee there. Nice outdoor deck and fireplace, we were the only people using the area. Desk staff was friendly and helpful, the bar upstairs was nice. We didn't try the restaurant. The only downside was our view of the rooftops behind the Donatello. We wished we'd asked for a street view.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Aoi
Reviews.Content: Courteous reception staff - Evita especially welcoming and helpful. Spacious room with kitchenette and good dressing area with ironing board.. Poor lighting in sleeping area. Excellent bed. Quiet. Continental breakfast a complete disapointment - little seating available and the quality of the food poor. Coffee out of a thermos flask not adequate or acceptable. Little effort to satisfy guests in this aspect. Otherwise, a lovely stay in a convenient hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Donatello”
Reviews.Author: FLgal8
Reviews.Content: The Donatello is a great hotel right in the middle of things in San Francisco. You can walk to shopping, restaurants, etc. The hotel staff was wonderful!! From the valets, to the maids, to the Front Desk staff, we found them to be quite helpful and knowledgeable. The room was quite large and comfortable. There is a great Club Room upstairs with a large fireplace where you can sit and watch TV if you want to get out of your hotel room for a while, but we spent most of our time seeing all the sites around San Francisco. Lots to see there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but noisy!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: gnatty
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews and looking at photos, I was expecting more. It was ok, but if you have a room over the street, don't expect to get much sleep unless you crank the room's forced-air fan. At 4am there was a noise which sounded like a tractor, and when we were just getting back to sleep, a delivery truck idled noisily which sounded like just under our window- and we were on the 8th floor! We could hear every word the workers said. I went to the window and found out the latch didn't close all the way so I called the front desk, but they didn't seem very interested. The next few nights we turned the fan up and it drowned out most of the noise, but then we ended up with that irritated sinus feeling from all the dry air. The breakfast they offered wasn't worth the money, and their restaurant doesn't open that early, but we ate across the street at another hotel. The rooms were larger than I expected after reading the reviews. They had a kitchenette area which came in handy. The bathrooms were another story. They looked like they hadn't been remodeled since the 80's and the shower area looked like motel 6. I got an excellent rate of 172.33 per night from Travelocity group rate, so I didn't feel like complaining. The lounge area was nice, and they had coffee, tea and muffins set out. The jacuzzi was out of order, but the small gym was ok. The staff was nice enough. We didn't have much contact with them during our stay, but the week before I had called their concierge to ask about fun stuff to do during New Years and he emailed me about 10 pages of suggestions. The location is great for shoppers. Union Square is just down the street, with Macys, H&M and of course the mall and all the great shops on Post St. We walked to Chinatown, and it wasn't too far. The Cable cars are close by the mall, but the lines were very long. We did have a great trip all told, but it was because we were with a large family group and well, it was San Francisco at New Years!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, passive-agressive service”
Reviews.Author: goodtravel
Reviews.Content: The location is terrific - a block from cable car, 2 blocks from Union Square. The room is well decorated, though noisy and on a small side. Upstairs concierge(s) do not say hello, used the speaker phone to talk to the returns department at Macy's (spare me!), my request for missing newspaper was answered with "it'll get here". The breakfast area was tastefully decorated with smelly garbage bags the day after Christmas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal! Best Staff Ever!”
Reviews.Author: MoneyB
Reviews.Content: I'm a DJ and have travelled all over the world doing gigs at various clubs and venues. I was spinning @ Ruby Skye right across the street, so this was a perfect location. In all my travels never have I met a more professional and fun loving staff than at The Donatello. Jesus @ the front desk was entertaining. He and the entire front desk really made me feel welcomed. The bell staff was really on it and always welcomed me back with a smile. I had requested a smoking room and was placed on the 6th floor and I have to say the maid that did my room was a delight and when I needed anything she got it to me right away. In fact she was so sweet that I felt guilty having her service the room. I keep late hours and did not get to try the breakfast that was included but instead went over to Max's right on the corner and to Dottie's a couple of blocks away, both great recommendations. Actually while checkin out I over heard others complaining about the noise from the club across the street and I thought to myself that it was partially my fault, but really who expects peace and quiet when you're in a city with great nightlife! I've read other reviews and to me this place is on the top of my list.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Donatello”
Reviews.Author: CSNunes
Reviews.Content: Me and my friends stayed at the Donatello for a week, while at a conference. I must say that we were 4 and they gave us the Presidential Suite, which is great a complete flat, with kitchen, 3 rooms (very good size), 3 bathroom and a lounge. Still for a presidential suite I was expecting more quality. The decoration was old fashion, and that is the lowest point of the room. The rest was superb! The staff was very friendly, the room very clean, the bed very confortable! The view from the windows was great. The location was very good, just next to Union Square and the cable cars. The services was great, they were very helpfull with the bags, the taxis, the bill, the room. The hotel just has a very old fashion decoration and is in need of renovations. The lowest part of the hotel is the breakfast, they say it is included in the price, but it is very poor. Really, just orange juice, coffee and some pastries. There is no milk, no cereais, no fruit no yogurts, no bread ... nothing. And the pastries are just too sweet .... one gets sick after one day. I would prefer for the breakfast not to be included, at least you would go to some nice places down the street and not be feeling like you are paying twice.

Reviews.Title: “Frequent Donatello Guests”
Reviews.Author: Puter
Reviews.Content: We live about an hour and a half from San Francisco and we have season theater tickets. Except for the JW Marriott, the Donatello is our favorite hotel to spend the night. (They are across the street from each other.) We go to hotelres.com and look for the "parking and breakfast" package, which we can usually get for around $165, or less, depending upon the season and conventions in the city, etc. Since hotels in the city are charging $40 and up for parking we consider it a bargain for the convenience. Granted, the "breakfast" is only orange juice, coffee and rolls, but it is served in the top floor lounge with three terraces with views and free newspaper and a fireplace. This floor also has a fitness center for guests, if you have time. Besides being a hotel-type accommodation, this is also a kind of "resort" property with some people owning time share accommodations. I don't know how that works, but it is irrelevant, really, if you are staying there. The rooms average 425 square feet and include a sitting area, a wet bar, with coffee maker, sink, fridge and microwave, and there is electronic equipment like a DVD player, etc. Also granted, if you are in a corner room on Mason and Post, early morning noise can be a problem. We simply ask for a room away from the noise. The hotel is well run, has a good restaurant, and is located a block away from Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay, but be sure and get a deal.”
Reviews.Author: EbethDallas
Reviews.Content: The Donatello was decorated in fun colors and was very comfortable. There was a bit of street noise later in teh evening and early morning, but it was bearable. The breakfast consisted mainly of coffee and pastries. The location was decent. We had rented a car because we planned to go to wine country later in the trip, but we would have had to rely on public transportation to get to the piers if we hadn't. All in all, it was a nice stay, but not worth paying through the nose for. If you can get a nice deal on a room, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Henk01
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel..from check inn (brought us free bottle champage because we were celebrating 40th wedding aniversery) untill check out GREAT service, beautifull room, the friendliest staff I have met in this 4 week vacation we had in the usa. Only minus is the fact that there rooms do not have double glass and (sometimes) that can cause streetnoise or worse (across the street there was a place with lots of screaming/cabs/drinking etc. untill 3.00 in the morning). Otherwise perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: camobscura
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Donatello for two nights back in July and we were quite pleased. We thought we had a good rate to begin with (breakfast & parking included) -but upon checking in we were upgraded to a terrace room. I have to say that it pretty much made our stay. The room opened up to a large & nicely maintained balcony with a great view. Luckily these rooms do not face any of the streets. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. They even left wine and chocolates for us the first night. Again, San Francisco is amazing but our trip was made even better being able to stay in such a pleasant hotel. We would definitely reccommend the Donatello.

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: dedicated-doctor
Reviews.Content: I came to san francisco in october for a conference at the moscone center and I stayed at the donatello for one night. I was pleasantly surprised. I have read excellent review about the hotel and they are all true. The rooms are large, very clean, recently renovated. Bed very confortable, bathroom very clean. The staff is very nice and proffesional. There is also breakfast served, but only few pastries ( all sweet) and coffee and orange juice. There is place for some improvement in that area. Location is excellent, near the Union Square where all the shops and transportaion is convenienly located. The only disadvantage was the noise, as already discussed upon. We were on the 12th floor but facing the main street ( the hotel is located on the corner, so it is facing 2 streets) . We had just arrived from an overseas flight and we had a 10 hour time difference, so I woke up at 2 am and couold not sleep for about 1 1/2 hours because of the noise ( some garbage trucks??). So I guess if your room faces the back or you do not have a jet lag, this will not be a problem. Definitely excellent value for the money. I also stayed at a hotel twice the price but closer to the moscone convention center and that choice was not worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: AngelikaPickles
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Donatello for four nights during our honeymoon trip to California. When we arrived in our room, the staff had left complimentary champagne and chocolates in our room! We stayed in a room at the back of the hotel on the tenth floor. We had a king bed and a seating area with a sofa and armchair. The room had a very large TV and a hifi. The bathroom was small but had everything necessary. There was also a little bar/utility area near the bathroom with a microwave, coffee maker, sink, iron, safe etc. The room was fairly small but clean and had everything we needed. Our rate included a contintental breakfast served in the Club Lounge on the top floor. The breakfast consisted of donuts, coffee and orange juice. We went elsewhere for breakfast a couple of mornings. The concierge who "registered" us for the club lounge on the first day was a little annoying and rude on one occasion. Another concierge who was on duty on our first night was very pleasant and recommended a great nail salon nearby. The hotel location was great, just a block from Union Square and the Powell-Hyde cable car line. The front desk staff and the bellmen were very pleasant. The WiFi in the hotel did not work well with our MacBook - we had to download Firefox to get it to work - something to bear in mind for Mac users if internet access is important to you. Also, once we did manage to get it to work, it was very slow, by far the slowest we came across during our trip. Overall, we would recommend the Donatello for its great location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: marco34
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel during our visit to San Francisco for our 5th wedding anniversary. The rooms are quite sizeable & clean for San Francisco and full of great amenities. The rooms include a fridge, microwave, wet bar sink, and toaster. A coffeemaker is standard as well. The front desk, bellhop, and housekeeping staff are very well trained, friendly and have great customer service. The location of the hotel is ideal for shopping, sightseeing and tends to dodge landing straight in the middle of all the tourists. A plus in my opinion. Given the prime downtown location the rooms are also pretty quiet. A bit of street noise heard occasionally but nothing overwhelming. The only thing that seemed a bit off and didn't quite seem to blend with the friendly personality of the rest of the staff was the concierge. The concierge seemed friendly until we didn't want to go to their Napa time share property presentation. I found this to be a bit standoffish and kind of goes against the friendly nature of the rest of the staff. Just an observation. Otherwise, our stay was fantastic and we will definetly stay at the Donatello during future visits to San Francisco. A great 4 star ranked hotel with 3 star rates!

Reviews.Title: “They claimed someone canceled our rooms”
Reviews.Author: mochadog
Reviews.Content: Last year, 10/06, a group of us stayed at the Donatello. The rooms were dated, but clean - great price and location to Union Square was perfect. The purpose of the group staying there was to run the Nike Womens Marathon - a marathon benefiting Leukemia and Lymphoma. The start line is in Union Square so location was key. We booked rooms (4) again for this years Marathon. We booked back in March. We got so detailed we even had the room numbers of each room with our confirmation. We called to make a minor adjustment to our reservation 2 days prior to our arrival and we were told someone had called and canceled our rooms. They were able to give us a date of cancellation, but no name. They basically said we are out of luck because the hotel was full - end of story. Now our group is out of rooms and would have to pay triple or even quadruple the price to get a replacement room. Management and the concierge at the Donatello didn't offer to help us find alternate places to stay or even make any offers to help resolve their claimed "cancellation" I am very upset and disappointed. I feel completely ripped off and betrayed.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel near Union Square”
Reviews.Author: prasenberg
Reviews.Content: For my second stay in San Francisco I looked for a hotel near Union Square. Another requirement was in the room internet. The location of The Donatello is fantastic. One block from Union Square. Diners, shops, public transport, all very close to the hotel. The rooms are pretty good too. Clean, well equipped with TV, coffee machine, and all the usual stuff you expect in a hotel of this class. However, the wireless internet was almost unusable. I was moved to another room after complaining about this. That did help a bit, but not much. Staff was helpful and friendly. I think the hotel is a bit overpriced (I payed over 150 euro/210 dollar a night), but as long as wifi is not that important to you, I can definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Value”
Reviews.Author: Caring_Bear
Reviews.Content: Great location, great value. We stay in SF quite a bit, and these are the largest standard rooms we've come across, especially for the price. Fairly good ventilation also, which is not alsways easy to find in SF. The location is awesome, less than 2 blocks to Union Square. If you need a car rental Hertz is right next door. Dollar and Enterprise are 2 blocks away. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for SF/Union Square”
Reviews.Author: Ravens4ever
Reviews.Content: The Donatello is a great value for Union Square. The room was large, clean and comfortable. So overall, it was a good value for the rate (we only paid 119 a night for the weekend of Fleet Week). Keep in mind that due to the location, it is extremely noisy (car alarms in the middle of night, people on the street at all hours, numerous garbage trucks early in the AM). If you are a light sleeper, look elsewhere.
