Also we were a little disappointed that the brand new, wide screen TV in our room could not get a signal (although to their credit someone from maintenance did try to fix it at 9:30 PM on a Saturday night). There is also a â€œcontinental breakfastâ€� offered, but that is nothing more than a couple of muffins and donuts. The front desk staff and bellmen were very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay for a decent price”
Reviews.Author: Sunrise11
Reviews.Content: Very nice & clean room centrally located at a decent price. It wasn't anything luxurious but the parking package we got made it a good deal. It was clean and relatively newly renovated. For what we paid and for the time we actually spent in the room, I felt good about the value we were getting. No real complaints about this place and would definitely recommend it for anybody looking for a good base place while touring San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel - Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: SailChicago
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at the Donatello Hotel based on Trip Advisor member recommendations. The Donatello is a clean property, located is a fairly good area within one block of Union Square and the Powell-Hyde Cable Car line. We were offered an upgrade to a Terrace Room, but were not informed by the front desk that a Terrace Room has no air conditioning! When I raised the issue the next morning that the air conditioning didn't work (nothing in the room indicated that), I was greeted with somewhat of a response of "duh!! you were in a Terrace Room!...and a Terrace Room has no air conditioning!" In addition, we had a service tech up to our room twice because we could get no hot water in the shower. He said he did not have the replacement part, and he could only take it apart and have it scalding hot or cold. So we had cold water ..and I mean cold water for showers. In addition, the television was barely visible with "snowy" reception. When we went to the Club Level for continental breakfast after being told the restaurant does not serve breakfast, we found the continental breakfast consisted of donuts, orange juice, and coffee. No cereal, no yogurt, no fruit. When I reaised the issue of lousy TV reception, no air condinotioning, and cold water at the front desk at check-out, I was still charged full price, and told they would have the manager call or email me the same day. I am still waiting for a call or email two days later. On the positive side, our hot room was clean and fairly spacious. My recommendation: don't stay at the Donatello if it is a special occasion or you are planning a nice weekend in San Francisco.. If you are looking for a no frills, clean, basic hotel with unresponsive customer service if something goes wrong, then the Donatello may meet your expectations...but it certainly did not meet mine, and I will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A great start, great staff, overall good”
Reviews.Author: Portia1972
Reviews.Content: We tayed there for 3 nights. The rooms are spacious and the staff there are very friendly and helpful. It is a block away from Union Square and its very easy to walk to the train and other locations. Not much of a breakfast, but otherwise clean, comfy and affordable. Good cafes and malls close by, so overall it was very convinient. It was safe to walk late at night there and had no issues.

Reviews.Title: “Donatello, great for honeymooners!”
Reviews.Author: Kikisette
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel based on positive TripAdvisor reviews. Location & size of the room vs. price couldn't be beat -paid $150 per night incl valet parking. I mentioned that we were honeymooners and would like a quiet room off the street, which was granted. Champagne and chocolates were waiting for us in our very large and nicely appointed room. All the staff were wonderful, polite and helpful with directions, advice, etc. Try the Pinecrest Diner for a great breakfast, Max's for a casual dinner...both great and right by the hotel. Our plane arrived late our first evening, we were tired and just wanted a nice dinner within walking distance of the hotel. The front desk suggested Luna on Castro St, 2 block walk. Small Italian restaurant with outdoor seating. Friendly staff and the best Carbonara I've ever had (and I've had a lot!) Would stay at the Donatello again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BoppUK
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a Fortnight travelling around California. The Donatello was our first hotel of the trip. What a great way to start! Our room was really spacious, light & airy and the staff couldn't have been more helpful. The breakfast was a simple affair, but the pastries and coffees in the relaxing rooftop room were greatly appreciated. The greatest advantage of The Donatello is the superb location, literally one block from Union Square and the cable cars makes it a good base for exploring the city. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “First Rate Experience”
Reviews.Author: lesliegb
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our honeymoon based on ratings at TripAdvisor. I thought the price was very fair compared to other hotels in a similar location. Our room was beautiful -- a nice corner room -- very spacious, clean, with very comfortable bed, as well as nice entertainment center and bar area. Given the location, the room was very quiet and confortable. The most wonderful thing about our stay was the staff -- they could not have been nicer or more helpful. The sent up complimentary champagne and chocolates when they found out we were on our honeymoon. And the last day we were there, I got sick with an infection, and they were gracious enough to allow us to check out late in the afternoon without charging more money and inquired about my health when we checked out. It's a fabulous location, a very nice room and great customer service. We will definitely stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience.”
Reviews.Author: highm
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 night stay in San Francisco at the Donatello Hotel. It was absolutely wonderful. The location is superb. Very convenient to Union Square and the cable cars, buses, etc. You would never need to leave the area for anything. The hotel itself was superb. The staff was more than accommodating. The rooms were spacious and the bed was terriffic. Free wireless internet. The continental breakfast was fabulous, whether you were charged or not. Some reservations include it, some do not. Overall, this hotel was an excellent experience. It was quiet and everything was at the hotel or the area that you needed. You can't go wrong with the Donatello!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Places
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 6 nights while attending the AAAS conference. Very convenient only two blocks away from Hilton where majority of meetings took place. I agree with other reviewers on many of their comments regarding rooms. Great large and bright room. There was no free breakfast when we were there. Only a free coffee on the top floor where also concierge is stationed which seems an awkward place for a concierge. On three different mornings there were three different people and all preoccupied with talking on a phone or too absorbed with a computer. I thought that was a puzzling behavior since they should provide a service to the hotel's gusts but we really like this hotel. Shouldn't be a concierge stationed in a lobby? We too were awaken a couple nights when a crowd from a night club got outside. I would definitely return and recommend this hotel. Thank you Puter.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: HP33
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel!! Loved the location and the rooms. It is in Union Square which is great for shopping, nightlife and trolly tours. The bed was amazingly confortable and the room was well decorated. The staff was wonderful as well. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great time at The Donatello”
Reviews.Author: EnigmaGirl
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a great trip to San Francisco where we stayed at The Donatello in Union Square. The hotel is clean and the front desk people are great - very accomodating. Sarah the concierge was wonderful! The hotel's location is fabulous, just steps from everything you'd want to do. Great restaurants, shopping, etc. and San Fran is very "walker friendly". We covered most of the city on foot and only opted for public transportation a few times. The rooms were spacious and the housekeeping service was prompt and thorough. We were in the "Club Donatello" part since we did it through a timeshare thing but I can only assume that the rest of the rooms were as nice as ours.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: edna2007
Reviews.Content: Our three night stay at the Donatello was great. The rooms were large, comfortable and clean. The people behind the desk were helpful and informative. The location is great....we walked all over...to the whalf (around 40minutes), China Town (5 minutes), Italian District,(15-20 minutes), Union Square,(one minute) etc. Also near public transportation for those who rather ride. We would go back to the Donatello. The breakfast was not the greatest though...they provided different danishes or donuts with coffee and juice. We would have preferred more options with our continental breakfast...

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Donatello”
Reviews.Author: luvhouses
Reviews.Content: I did alot of research about the downtown area and friends told me about the Union Square area. We didn't want to pay $300 per night for a room and found this gem online! GREAT roomy rooms, awesome staff and perfect location were just perfect. This is one block off the main square so it was perfect for hopping on the cable cars to go to the wharf. Rate included breakfast (not that great, just doughnuts/coffee and OJ) and parking. That saved us so much money! Check online for booking as we got great rates!! Ask for a high floor not facing the street to keep noise to a minimum! I would highly recommend this hote to anyone! Go to the Wharf and take the Alcatraz Tour! It was great!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: DCtripster
Reviews.Content: As we are accustomed to East Coast hotel prices, we were suspicious that somehow the $111 per night deal we got through Venere.com would not be honored by the hotel, considering the quality of this hotel. You can hardly get a bed in a shared room at the YMCA in Manhattan for that price. However, we were charged exactly the price I had reserved online, and the quality of our room and the hotel were great. The front desk people were also extremely friendly and professional, a lot more so than at most hotels we have been to. The decor is nice, the bed is comfortable, and having a microwave, fridge, sink, cups and other kitechen supplies was very convenient. The closet is also quite large for a hotel room. Also, the turn down service, including chocolates, is a very nice touch for such an affordable hotel. The location of the Donatello, as many other guests have said, is pretty good. Close to the Market Street Bart stop, cable car, and various buses, which we all used, and it's very easy to catch a cab right next to the hotel, which we also did. There's great shopping nearby, as well as Walgreen's and other convenience stores/delis, and a pretty good 24-hour diner about a block or two away (down the street parallel to Market Street.) I do have a few gripes, though. For instance, I called the Donatello a few days before our stay to make sure they had our reservation, and I asked them at that time if they thought we'd be able to check in at about noon, which is when we expected to arrive at the hotel. The man I spoke with indicated with confidence that this should not be a problem at all. However, when we got there, around noon, there were no clean rooms available. It was a little hard on us to walk around town for a couple hours, having been up since about 3 am DC time. That said, they did tell us we could sit in the club room upstairs if we wanted, and also, they took my cell phone number and called me at around 2 pm, I think, to let me know our room was available. They had let us leave our luggage, and the bellboy brought our suitcases up immediately after we arrived at our room. Another gripe- there was a lot of car-horn honking every night, all night, and a lot of noise from people on the streets below. I think the car lot just below our window belonged to Hertz, but I'm not sure about that. We are quite used to urban noise, and still found the noises hard to get used to. Also, we didn't have any view to speak of- just that car lot and the backs and tops of some nearby buildings. And one final gripe, although we did really like this hotel- when we checked in, there was one hotel staff member who tried to get us to go on some kind of "free" tour, with some kind of nice breakfast, which requires that you endure some kind of pitch for a timeshare, or something like that. I didn't listen too attentively, as we already had our own plans, but I find that kind of thing very annoying. I think they give that spiel to every guest. Anyway, despite a few gripes, we were very pleased with the Donatello, and we would definitely stay there again, as long as the price stays in an affordable range. One more thing- there's a nice place for a dessert, breakfast or light meal about a block or two from the hotel on Post Street (away from Market Street). I forgot the name, but they have all kinds of crepes, and my boyfriend had a yummy crepe with Nutella.

Reviews.Title: “Donatello always good with exceptional staff”
Reviews.Author: lessalt
Reviews.Content: We always stay at the Donatello when we can get away to San Francisco. The staff are always so pleasant, friendly and helpful. Parking is right on the premises unlike some other small downtown hotels. Sometimes they have specials where they include the parking. Again, this is something to inquire about when booking a Union Square hotel. The location is excellent, one block from Union Square. The rooms are quite spacious, usually with extra furniture for relaxing or guests. There is a microwave, small refrig. and a small cup coffee maker in the room. I also appreciate the fact that they have real wine glasses and pottery mugs. On the top floor is the clubhouse where you can get coffee, orange juice, and breakfast pastries in the morning. Also provided there are free local papers and brochures regarding tourist attractions. I will admit the Donatello's rooms and public spaces could use some updating. However, it's clean and comfortable. I've stayed at the Westin St. Francis one block over for twice the price, plus had to pay an additional $40 per night for parking. Their rooms are also dated and once the sheets were so worn I put my foot right through. I'll pass on the Westin and continue to use the Donatello.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveler26
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for only one night, but will be staying here on my next trip to San Francisco. The staff was very friendly. Chuck the concierge was very knowledgable on the area and can help with setting up wine tours, restaurant reservations and more. He actually recommended a great chinese restaurant that delivers ( Was too tired from walking around all day). No need to rent a car. Fisherman's Wharf is only a $10 cab ride (actually $9.40 to and $8.40 back). Union Sq. is 1 block away, China Town 5 blocks. Also take advantage of the daily happy hour at the bar. My girl and I had 6 beers and 2 appetizers for less that $40 with tip.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: bigamm
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough wonderful things about this fabulous hotel. We are Shell Vacation club members and booked our stay through their reservation service. The hotel is one or two blocks away from everything: Union Square, cable cars, public transit, shopping, fine dining and family restaurants, We had a car and used their valet service. We never waited more than a few minutes for our car and everyone was helpful with directions. My husband, our 17-year old daughter and I were very comfortable in our large room with king-sized bed and pull out queen sofa. The staff were the best, from the reception desk to the concierge and bell service. Free coffee, tea and hot chocalate were much appreciated in the top-level lounge, along with the wonderful view! We will absolutely return to the Donatello on our next trip West.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay 1 big downfall”
Reviews.Author: m_wartick
Reviews.Content: The donatello was a great hotel right in the heart of San Francisco, just a block from Union square, and 3 blocks from the very busy Powell street public transportation stop that includes BART, Muni, Cabel Cable Cars, and the F-line stop. The hotel is a small boutique with the service of a 4 star hotel. My wife and I were traveling on our honeymoon, and when I made our reservation, I informed the staff of this. Upon our arrival, our room included a bottle of Champagne, a box of chocolates, and a hand written note congradulating us. The rooms are HUGE compared to other rooms in downtown St. Louis. They include a huge bed, sitting area with a pull-out couch, microwave and mini fridge, along with dishes and a wet bar. The bathroom was a normal hotel bathroom. IF YOU STAY HERE, be sure to request a room on the 5th FLOOR WITH A PATIO. half of the rooms on the 5th floor open up on to a semi private patio with a table and chairs. There is no extra charge and they are more than willing to accomadate if you ask. These rooms are also a little bigger than others. The patio was a nice touch. The staff was very friendly and helped us get around the city. The one BIG downfall was the breakfast. Breakfast was a pastry and a glass of orange juice and it cost $4 per person (IT WASN"T EVEN INCLUDED IN THE HOTEL PRICE). That's a big negative, but it is not enough to ruin this great hotel with great rooms and wonderful service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, but Some Problems”
Reviews.Author: PDXDon
Reviews.Content: To begin, I thought The Donatello was an excellent value. The room was huge and nicely appointed. However, it was clear that the hotel (at least our room) had seen better days. The mattress was well past the point of needing replacement. While most of the room was nice and clean, the tub was quite grimy and looked like it hadn't been scrubbed in some time. Also, something seemed to be wrong with the plumbing because the shower made a terrible racket. Attention to detail was lacking. At check-in, the staff was helpful and friendly. However, when we returned from a late night on the town, nobody was at the desk. When somebody finally emerged, they looked like they had just woken up. We asked about anywhere to get a late bite to eat, and the response wasn't very helpful. "There's a Jack N' the Box around the corner." Thanks. I guess. When we returned from our unsuccessful attempt to get late night food (the area felt kind of sketchy late at night, so we gave up quickly), the desk clerk was again absent. We were able to walk through the lobby and go up the elevator without seeing anyone! Very poor security. In summary, The Donatello was a great value and might be worth checking out if you want a big room and a relatively nice environment. That being said, however, I think we will check out some other options next time we are in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Digs”
Reviews.Author: adzonni
Reviews.Content: Wow-just got back from San. Fran. The Donatello is casual chic-great digs for the bucks! Helpful staff, great location, rooms are loaded! No problems here-it's all good! Enjoy your stay! :- )

Reviews.Title: “Very nice reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: WVU98grad
Reviews.Content: I was in San Fran on Business and stayed at The Westin St. Francis for 4 days. Then I moved to the Donatello to save some money for an extended vacation. All I have to Say is that the Donatello had much larger rooms and more accomidating than the St. Francis. The locations is GREAT, rooms are a bit older but VERY nice, large, includes a kitchennette, hot tub on top floor, and staff is always friendly. I didn't eat at the hotel but the bar was nice. Plus if you need to rent a car for a napa vacation, 3 or 4 rental companies are within walking distance. Overall, I have stayed in San Fran at least a dozen times over the last 10 years and this is the best value for the dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: jMarS
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Donatello from 6th to 10th June. The very best thing about the hotel is the location. I would stay there again for that reason alone. It was about a minute's walk from Union Square which is where we spent most of our time. It was a short walk from the BART and the Cable Car which made it easy to get to other areas of the city. The room was large and comfortable, the bathroom was clean and fairly spacious and I can't really think of anything negative. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and curtious and the Concierge was always helpful. The only minor gripe I can think of is that the internet kiosk didn't work. which was a little inconvenient but as we were in such a good location it was fairly easy to find an internet cafe. Also, we were told on arrival that breakfast was included in our rate but when we went up to the top floor for breakfast on our first day we found that it was just a selection of cakes, doughnuts or pastries. I think you could ask for fruit but it didn't look very appetising. Other than that this hotel is worth staying at as it was good value for money and in an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “loved the Donatello”
Reviews.Author: kiwinz_7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 5 nights at The Donatello at the end of May. What a great hotel that exceeded our expectations. It was in a great location handy to Union Square, Market street and Powell St Cable Cars. The room was so spacious. Very comfortable bed. I loved the coffee maker in our room beautiful coffee on demand. It had a microwave and fridge plus crockery if you were inclined to eat in. Breakfasts were a bit of a letdown as all you could eat were sweet pastries but there was certainly a variety to choose from. Club lounge where breakfast was served was very nice. Club concierge were very happy to help with directions and also reccommend sights. Looked forward to the chocolate beside the bed every night! If we were to find ourselves in San Francisco again I would most certainly be booking in.

Reviews.Title: “A delight!”
Reviews.Author: CincyOH
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel! Very clean, large room, EXTREMELY friendly and helpful staff. Is in the heart of it all in Union Square just a block from the cable cars and a few blocks from great shopping. Being in the heart of it all does make for a little more street noise than usual but nothing dramatic. Good continental breakfast of pastries and coffees in the rooftop club room. We had a great rate including parking and breakfast from hotelres.com. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at reasonable price for central San Fancisco”
Reviews.Author: J&JWOxfordshire
Reviews.Content: The Donatello is a very pleasant hotel located right off Union Square in San Francisco. We found the service to be very good, the room simple but reasonably well appointed. Check in was great, they who we were and we got checked-in in about 1 minute flat. The rooms are pretty big (we had a double aspect corner room on 6th floor on the Corner of Mason and Post St, I think). They have all facilities (including basic kitchen facilities), and a sofa, safe, free wifi, etc. The bathroom in our room was a bit basic - the decor was not brilliant but it was useable and pretty clean. Being in a city centre it was not a quiet place to stay, there were sirens, people partying (out on the street) and trucks and vehicles all night - the windows were not very well soundproofed at all and our sleep was occasionally disturbed a bit by this. Overall though, definitely good value and we would probably stay again (might check and see if they have any quieter rooms first). Check-out was as quick and easy as check-in.

Reviews.Title: “What a great surprise!”
Reviews.Author: SylvesterMontreal
Reviews.Content: We were not sure what to expect. But what a pleasant surprise it was. Centrally located, great service, great room (with a free upgrade!). We could not ask for a better choice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Donatello”
Reviews.Author: marie125
Reviews.Content: Great location, nice room, but the best part was the staff. Everyone was extremely helpful and friendly. Would definitely stay here again when coming to San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and large rooms, nice decor, and good location. noisy though!”
Reviews.Author: TimIL747
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate on rooms at the Donatello when in town for a conference. The rooms are large, clean, and decorated nicely. Bed was great and there is even free wireless internet. My only complaint is every morning I could not sleep past 8 AM because there was always car noise from the street. Lots of horns honking that were impossible to sleep through. Other than that, great hotel that I would consider staying at again. Just try to get a room that is away from the street noise. (not sure if possible)

Reviews.Title: “This place should be 5 stars!”
Reviews.Author: liltarap55
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 1 night here at this hotel on Saturday, May 3, and I wish I would have had at least 5 more! After reading the awesome reviews on Trip Advisor, I was able to secure a room through their website for $139/night with valet parking included! Very reasonable. We drove up Saturday morning from Monterey, CA to see Spiderman 3 on the IMAX at the Metreon and to go to the nightclub Ruby Skye. We couln't have picked a better location. Period. Upon our arrival, the bellhop was curteous and very patient as I unloaded ALL the crap I had brought for my 1 night stay (you know how many shoes women like to bring!). Mark, the front desk man, was extremely nice. When I entered our hotel room, I was astonished at the size of the room! If you've visited San Francisco, then you are aware that most normal hotel rooms are pretty tiny. This room had to be around 400 sq. feet! It was very modernly designed and the comforter on the bed was one of the softest I have slept under. We hadn't been in our room more than 10 minutes when there was a knock at the door and the maid was there to give us our complimentary bath robes. The concierge also called to say she was sorry she had missed us when we checked in, and to come down for our free maps of San Francisco (which had an AWESOME map of all the shopping places). Talk about great service! I've visited 5 star hotels and not been paid attention to this much. They have a jacuzzi, and men/women dry saunas as well as a fitness club. I didn't get a chance to visit their restaurant Zingari, but it looked very nice. The biggest WOW for me was when my husband and I opened the curtains to check out our view and TADA! Ruby Skye was DIRECTLY in front of us. We could literally CRAWL home from the club if we needed to. ;) So instead of showing up at the club at 10pm to avoid the line, and then waiting until 1am for the headlining DJ to come on, we were able to drink our alcoholic beverages in our room and peek out the window every 15 minutes or so to make sure the line wasn't getting too long. It was so great! For all you Ruby Skye visitors, we were in room 601. The Donatello is located right in the heart of Union Square and we didn't have to walk for more than 5 minutes to get to all the shopping. I think I have found the hotel that I will stay at almost every time I want to visit San Fran. We were just so surprised and SO pleased. You rock Donatello. Plain and simple.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: marcbo111
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel. Staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Rooms were quite large. Booked through RCI. The hotel is centrally located that you can walk to most everything. I read many TA reviews and these were right on. Only thing I would stay away from is the hotel restaurant, Zingari. Awful, service in particular. My understanding is the hotel and restaurant are managed seperately, which is quite obvious with how we were treat at the hotel versus the restaurant. I would stay here again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience!”
Reviews.Author: OSUTwoOne
Reviews.Content: First two nights of our honeymoon stay were at this surprisingly exceptional hotel in downtown San Francisco near Union Square. Upon our arrival, the front desk affirmed that it was our honeymoon (we had mentioned this on the phone months ago in making our reservation). Wonderful complimentary champagne and chocolates were immediately sent to our room, along with a congrats card - a very nice and unexpected beginning of our stay. The room itself was fabulous, VERY spacious, clean, and modern. My wife loved the decorating (much of it done in the colors of our undergrad school). The bathroom, small kitchenette, and closet were all very clean and nicely sized. The view left a lot to be desired, although we did understand that exceptional views of the city would be hard to come by in downtown SF, so no complaints there. Bed and linens were very soft, and we enjoyed the turndown service and arriving back to the hotel after our activities. Location of the hotel couldn't be beat. Only two blocks away from the hustling busyness of Union Square and its myriad of shops, restaurants, and malls. The hotel itself, is slightly set away from this conglomeration, so it was actually quieter than we initially anticipated. Also, only several blocks away is the SF cable car route, which we caught several rides on throughout our stay - truly enjoyable! Only one minor hiccup in our long, weekend stay. The concierge wasn't entirely helpful in giving us advice on things to do, places to eat or see. We informed that this was our first time to SF together, and essentially gave him a few expectations of what we would like. In return, it seemed as though we received a lot of canned responses or pieces of paper/brochures shoved our way. After nearly 10 minutes, we gave up and just set out to explore on our own. Nice enough guy, but we felt as though the overall helpfulness was lacking. All in all, a truly great experience and nice little secret in the heart of SF. Great location, amenities, and personal touch!

Reviews.Title: “Donatello is a good value”
Reviews.Author: Kansastravelers4
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Donatello during a week stay in the Bay area, including several nights at the nearby Monaco and also Napa Valley. The Donatello is in a good location with nice sized rooms and a good value. Although the Donatello lacked the personality of the Monaco, it was about $100 per night cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “understated 'gem'”
Reviews.Author: southlake
Reviews.Content: I celebrated my "special" birthday this past Dec with hubby in San Francisco, where we had visited about 7 yrs ago for 3 days. My timeshare offered The Donatello for a wk. Thanks to TA forums and members for helping me to choose this hotel.....it was fabulous! The location couldn't have been better for our sightseeing requirements. Because it is just down the street from Union Sq, we were able to walk almost anywhere, including down to Fisherman's Wharf, one day. The hotel is not large (which we prefer) but is beautifully appointed. The large room included enough amenities (microwave, free coffee etc, dishes) that you can have a meal "at home" if you didn't want to eat out. The staff were very personable and helpful with directions etc. They even sent me a "recognition" of my birthday which we enjoyed immensely. The guest lounge & patio was a very relaxing spot that offered free coffee etc almost all day. We ate at their restaurant Zingari once and although the food & service was good, the prices and ambience could use a little attention. I absolutely recommend this place to everyone and hope that it won't be too full for me the next time I want to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wowsers!”
Reviews.Author: Ms_Quilt
Reviews.Content: What a steal! We got a great rate -- that included parking -- and the room was huge. It also included coffee pot, frig, and microwave. Our rate included breakfast on the top-floor reception area. It was two pieces of pastry from a reputable local baker. Didn't have a chance to use the exercise room and jacuzzi but both looked terrific. We had dinner in their restaurant, Zingari, and although it cost more than the room, it was quite tasty. The Donatello is a great little secret. Only tell people you like about it!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: veedubrach
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through onlinehotels.com and got a great rate for any San Francisco hotel, let alone one of this standard. We were on a long trip and asked to store some luggage at the hotel for 12 days days before our stay, which they did without any problems. The rooms are large, and well equiped with a microwave, fridge, basic cutlery/crockery, tv, stereo and vcr. Complimentary wifi was also a huge bonus. A limited complimentary breakfast of pastries and coffee is also available. The staff were very helpful. The only minor problem we had was that our deposit via the internet booking was not recognised as paid so it took quite a few minutes upon checkout to sort this out. The location is a block from Union square. I doubt you could find better in San Francisco for the price we paid and would not hesistate in recommending this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: luv2dohair98
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the donatello probably about 5 years ago and remembered it being an AWESOME hotel...however since then, whenever we have tried to book, it has been really expensive. We definitely took advantage of the special the hotel was having on it's website! After arriving at the Donatello and into our room, we remembered why Donatello has always been our favorite hotel in SanFrancisco. We have stayed in many others, but they DO NOT compare to the Donatello. Perfect location, beautiful, spacious rooms, very friendly staff...we took another couple with us who thought it was the nicest hotel they have ever stayed at! Once again, thanks for not dissapointing us!:) We had even made a request ahead of time to keep our rooms near each other which they totally came through for us!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: lov2golf
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at The Donatello! Although I was only there 3 nights, the service was great, from the bell staff, the front desk staff, and housekeeping staff, all were very friendly and professional. The room was very nice, spacious for downtown San Fran, and I love the decor. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: susan420
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 3 night stay at The Donatello in San Francisco. As we had found this hotel through a time share company called Shell Vacations, we were not sure what to expect. I can say the hotel has an ideal location just one block from Union Square. It is an easy walk to shopping, restaurants and theatre. Parking was reasonably priced with in and out privleges. The bed was very comfortable. The room was spacious with a mini kitchen, fridge, microwave, sink and coffee maker. There was a small sitting area with a sofabed. The hotel staff was friendly and courteous. When I checked in, I requested an upgrade but was told that all rooms were the same. I asked about the terrace floor and was told that it was already full. The room decor was modern and looked like it had been recently updated. There is a small gym on the top floor. The spa is co-ed so bring a swim suit. We got in to see Jersey Boys which is one block away by just walking to the box office and buying tickets there one day before. We would stay at this place in a future trip to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite SF Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TrickyHobby
Reviews.Content: The Donatello is my new favorite hotel in SF. Courteous staff, efficient valet parking, good location, and the most amazing breakfast pastries you've ever eaten. We had the good fortune to stay on the fifth floor and have a terrace. Rooms are well-sized, bathroom is not too big/not too small, decent-sized closet space. Starbucks, Max's Opera Deli, Union Square, a pharmacy... all are within a block. Area around hotel is quiet at night. Kitchenette is perfect for travelers who don't want to eat out every meal - microwave, small refrigerator, utensils, plates, etc. There is no breakfast menu in the hotel, so no room service in the morning. However, the continental b'fast offered in the morning is exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “No Brainer”
Reviews.Author: RCM3
Reviews.Content: First trip to San Francisco. A cousin helped us find The Donatello. Our room rate included parking; our final bill just under $400 for two nights. We are mid-westerners and believed the $400 to be more than worth it. Parking experience...great; front desk help...great; concierge help...great; room...great. We were treated to soda and chocolates. Front Desk offered us Champagne as we were there for our 20th Anniversary. However we do not drink and I said how about some soda? We had 6 cans and the chocolates waiting for us when we arrived in our room (we had actually left on bus tour before we went to the room). Great, safe neighborhood. 1 block from Powell-Hyde Cable Car line. 4-5 blocks from F-Line train stop. No complaints...you will be happy here. And of course...we left our hearts there. Happy couple from Southern, Illinois

Reviews.Title: “A great location, lovely accomodations and an excellent value”
Reviews.Author: MLE642
Reviews.Content: This is a well located and nicely maintained hotel. We had a room with a king-size bed and a fold-out couch. There was a comfortable amount of room for the three of us. There was a small dressing area near the closet which was nice for some privacy as well storage. Beds were very comfortable, lighting was quite good, room and bath were always kept clean. We requested a room in the back of the hotel and it was fairly quiet (for a city center location). The location was excellent. It is two blocks from Union Square, near many theaters and restaurants, etc. Overall, it was a very pleasant place to stay for a week and we would certainly do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Donnatello”
Reviews.Author: lovingcarolina
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a Saturday evening for a three night stay and was given one of the patio rooms on the fifth floor as requested. We loved our room. Very clean, plenty of space with couch, wet bar with fridge, coffeepot, dishes, etc. The weather was great so we really enjoyed relaxing with our coffee out on the patio and reading the paper. The gentleman that checked us in informed us about the club lounge on the top floor with a complimentary continental breakfast. It was a little confusing when we got there because there was a sign saying there was a $4 charge for the breakfast but there wasn't anyone there to really collect money. Anyhow there were some pretty good pastries, coffee, tea, and juice. There is also a nice patio up there to enjoy. The staff was courteous and helpful. The location was very close to Union Square, public transportation, and restaurants. We felt very safe when walking to and from the hotel. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: princt2003
Reviews.Content: We spent 9 nights there in August, 2006. The location cannot be beat, directly behind the Westin St. Francis, a landmark hotel. Our check-in was very smooth and our room was unusually large for a hotel. I have read comments here about noise from the street but, considering that the hotel is smack in the middle of the downtown area, I did not find that a problem. Heavy street construction one day could be heard but what would you expect? Interior noise was non-existent - never heard other doors slamming shut as is usual in so many hotels. Our room was beside the elevators but we could not hear them. We found the staff very friendly and helpful. At no time were we approached about attending a time-share presentation and no employee ever put his hand out looking for a tip. The bell-hops were always around, friendly, helpful and just generally polite. The cleaning staff were just as nice and it was a treat to come back to the room in the evening and find the bed turned down and the proverbial chocolates on the pillow. The small fridge and microwave were a great addition. I would go back again without any hesitation. My only complaint is with San Francisco itself - so many street people and many of them mental health folks who seemed abandoned by the system. Something is very wrong in this department. Bill

Reviews.Title: “Good service, location and price”
Reviews.Author: VacationsRGreat
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a hotel in Union Square you should consider this one. It's just one block from the center of the action. We noted when we made our reservation that we were celebrating our anniversary and they sent up a complimentary bottle of wine and a small box of chocolates with a card. Nice touch! Pros: *Packages that include parking at a rate of $20 per night for valet (in and out privileges) *Very friendly and helpful staff *Proximity to Union Square and all the shops as well as the Curan Theater, both just one block away *They have 7 rooms on the 5th floor that have access to a shared terrace which is a nice feature in the city *Friday they offer complimentary wine from 4-5pm on the club level (available to all hotel guests) *Offers complimentary coffee and tea from 7am-10:30pm *Rooms have kitchenette so you can store your leftovers in the mini-fridge (a real empty mini-fridge, not one of those stocked with overprices drinks), warm them up or make popcorn in the microwave and use their utensils and dishes. *About 15 rooms on a floor so it was pretty quiet in terms of hall noise, etc. *Good sized rooms for the city - their website said 400 sq. ft. Cons: *VCR and no DVD player *Slightly older hotel so the tub was not a fancy jetted one, the color scheme was orange and blue but everything was very clean and well maintained Overall, it's was a good deal given the high rates for the summer tourist season in the other hotels in the area. The staff were very friendly and helpful and we did not have anyone talk to us about the timeshare option (part hotel, part time-share). Would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay again if we wanted to return to the Union Square area.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: tbaxtel
Reviews.Content: We just checked out yesterday. This was not our first visit, nor will it be our last. We are definite fans of this hotel! The service is impecable, the rooms are comfortable and very spacious and the location is just wonderful. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Helped get Honeymoon off to the right start”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My mother-in-law booked us at The Donatello for the weekend before going onto Hawaii for our Honeymoon, and my husband and I could not have been happier. I was so happy with our stay there that I just had to post a review about them. Upon arrival the bellmen and front desk were very helpful. After we had gotten settled into our room, which I felt was quite large for a studio in the city, we asked for recommendations for somewhere nearby to eat and the guys in the lobby pointed us to Max's across the street. Good food! After returning from lunch we were suprised to find a bottle of champagne and chocolates in the room congratulating us from the staff, and we didn't even mention that we were just married. When we went down to thank the guys at the front desk for the gesture we asked where to go for drinks and maybe go dancing. Not only did Deo give us great suggestion he also got us on the guest list for the club right across the street which was a blast. The desk clerks and bellmen paid a lot of attention to our needs and seemed very knowledgable. Marianne and Mark gave me great advice on the shopping nearby and the guys in the lobby; Deo, Chris and Nick, should have been annoyed with all my questions but instead were so helpful. In fact they even gave us great advice for our trip to Hawaii. I read other reviews of this hotel and it's true the staff is very helpful and we felt that they gave us very personalized service. I did however have a problem with the tv during our stay which was dealt with quickly, but we really didn't have much time to sit in the room and watch tv. Our stay inclduded a light continental breakfast which consisted of pastries, but I recommend going to Dottie's a couple of blocks away. The outside noise that others have complained about did not bother us. Yeah the hotel itself could offer more ammenities like a better breakfast or newer tv and dvd players but we would definetly return and recommend this hotel just on the experience we had with everyone we encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: enk56
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel. Great location downtown nr Union Square. Great room - high ceilings - if you can ask for a 5th floor room with a patio (only 6 available). Serious staff - very helpful. Nice club room on the top floor for continental breakfast. Recommended PS as an aside - be prepared for assertive begging downtown. SF should get to grips with this - otherwise - great city

Reviews.Title: “Great stay- would do it again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to San Francisco and the Donatello was a perfect choice. Even before we arrived I called them several times with questions about weather, transportation from airport and other local info I was curious about. Peter, the consierge, was helpful every time and so patient with my many questions. I also requested a room on the 5th floor, advice from a previous Trip Advisor review, and they filled the request for us. The reason we wanted the 5th floor was that it has a terrace patio---BIG!!! Wow, we loved the Donatello, the top floor lounge, the employees, the location could not have been better. I read a previous review that commented on the noise-- and it was a little noisy- but come on-- you're in the heart of downtown. A great place to stay-- the rooms are immaculate and HUGE!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel! Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Donatello in San Fran in September of 2005. We absolutely loved every second of it! The consierge was very helpful, the bellmen were so curteous, the front desk staff was superb. Ah yes... then onto the room. Emmaculantly clean, fully stocked, and modernly decorated. The bar was fun at night, the food was delicious. I could go on and on about our stay. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel !!! Everything you could wish for!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We finally got to the Donatelloâ€™s reception desk after a long trip through the pouring rain, with way too many suitcases to carry. The receptionists Chris and May made us instantly forget about the whole hassle! Never experienced such a Warm Welcome in a hotel before! We immediately felt at home. Our room at the Donatelloâ€™s was just excellent; comfortable bed, sound proof room, impeccably clean, excellent heating/cooling system, convenient bathroom, and some extras that we appreciated very much: TV-set, radio/CD audio system, wireless internet access, terrace (!) In the morning, you can go to The Donatelloâ€™s lounge to enjoy some coffee, tea, orange juice and pastries that are really sufficient to get you a kickstart. Apart from the fact that The Donatelloâ€™s is located in the very heart of the city (a few steps from Union Square), this is a highly recommendable hotel, just like that! Believe you me, we are very critical, hard-to-please customers and hotel guests, but us going to San Fran from now on means booking a room at The Donatelloâ€™s. This hotel means Quality, true hospitality and everything you could wish for. Isnâ€™t there really nothing on the down-side we could think of? Perhapsâ€¦ We donâ€™t think that The Donatelloâ€™s restaurant is worth the effortâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “great location, good service, good location - but needs soundproofing”
Reviews.Author: vicki1812
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in April 06 on a timeshare exchange and it is our 3rd return visit. Location is excellent - 2 mins from union square and the cable cars/buses/shops. Rooms and facilites are excellent, lovely king beds, good lines and bathroom freebies, nice marble bathroom and high quality fuurnishings. Rooms are huge and generall feature an oversize sofa which is very welcome after a day walking around SF However they do need to soundproof the rooms as like other reviewers we were kept awake at night by the noise - however we moved rooms and that helped a lot. After staying at the Donattello we now know that there is a quiet and a noisy side - we moved to room 1415 which was fine. We found the customer service standard to be very high and the concerige in the club lounge was super and very helpful. We did go to the bar one night but found it very expensive. I would visit again as the location is fantastic and the quality excellent, but next time I would buy ear plugs - however if you stay in the middle of a big city it will be noisy!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Jonito
Reviews.Content: We were guests of the Donatello for two nights in March, 2006. The location is excellent, one block from Union Square and five blocks from the Powell Street BART station. My mother and I were in the Bay Area to visit family so easy access to and from the hotel was absolutely necessary. We used public transportation everywhere (at least when not walking). San Francisco has a very inexpensive and efficient bus and subway system which I highly recommend. The room was superb, large with just the right amount and quality of ammenities. Since all rooms at the Donatello are king bedded it was wonderful having the pull-out sofa bed (an absolute must for people traveling with children or parents). Everyone at the hotel couldn't have been nicer. Very very friendly staff. But San Francisco is like that, people who are just nice to each other. We did not use the Club level with fitness room, jacuzzi, or concierge. We did however, go up to see it and were quite pleased. We could hear street noise from our room, but it wasn't that bad. The windows all open which is nice if you like the outside air, but the in room climate control was adequate. If you are sensitive to big city noises, then perhaps a large chain hotel with many stories is the place to stay. But then you will miss the charm of really getting close the vibrant city of San Francisco. We will certainly stay at the Donatello again.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms but too noisy”
Reviews.Author: slocal
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Donatello for one night. The rooms and hotel were nicely decorated and the service was friendly. The rooms were spacious (especially for a city hotel) as promised in Tripadvisor reviews. The hotel was also well located a block off Union Square. However, they need to have sound-proof windows installed. We had great difficulty sleeping through the night and were awakened often by screaming, horns, car alarms and delivery trucks.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms, poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Although the room was spacious and well maintained the customer service left a lot to be desired. The man who checked us in was unfriendly and showed no interest in answering our questions. He was the same person who checked us out and the only time he showed an interest in our stay was when he handed us the hotel evaluation form. He even critized another front desk staff person who was trying to find out why I had not received the promised morning newspaper. The Bellman and Concierage desk were helpful and couteous. The room was lovely but could have used a few more amenities in the kitchen area such a tea bags, hot chocolate, etc. We ordered a meal from room service once, a sandwich, which was not as it had been described on the menu but instead something that looked to be hastely put together without much taste or quality. Although the room smelled fresh, the hallway had a strong cigarrette order.

Reviews.Title: “Great place !!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just got back last week of 7 days of vaction there. I traded my timeshare time so the price for me was an absolute steal! The staff was very friendly and always made sure that I was comfortable. They had top notch service like their consierge and the housekeepers were earger to make my stay the best. Little touches like bed turn down service and when the housekeepers were finished cleaning the room they sprayed it with a heavenly fragerance. The bellmen were very helpful, giving tips and advice on where to go and how much to pay for taxis or public transportation. All in all I had a great time and wouldn't hesitate to stay their again.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem”
Reviews.Author: TheStranger22
Reviews.Content: Clean, spacious, great location, coffee in room, even had a stereo in the room along with the idiot tv. polite people. excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Research paid off! Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Okemosian
Reviews.Content: I also researched the Union Square area for a great hotel, and was very pleased with my choice of the Donatello. Our room was huge, clean, bright, airy, and we could step out onto a shared yet private terrace (5th floor room) complete with round tables and chairs. Amenities were outstanding. Bellman was very helpful as were the desk staff. We dined in the restaurant and had great Italian food. Location is ideal for Union Square area shopping and restaurants. Will book the same room next year when we return! Last year we stayed at Hotel Palomar (Kimpton Hotel) and the Donatello beats it by miles in every way, including price. Only minor drawback was street noise (we had an end room) but that's typical for many hotels in a big city.

Reviews.Title: “convenient, cute and clean”
Reviews.Author: socialsister
Reviews.Content: Quite spacious, this is my new favorite SF hotel. One block to Union Square and some great restaurants within walking distance. We were able to get a parking package which helped with not having to pay for that expense. Although we weren't in the room a lot, when we did come back it was nice to have 2 couches to lounge on while mapping out our plan for the next day's activities.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, cute rooms”
Reviews.Author: ajslc
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at several SF hotels 4*, 3*, boutique hotels and this is my new favorite. The room was large compared to most SF hotels and very clean. I liked that the room had a bright entry way with a closet, mirror and dresser right off the bathroom. Then the room had large king bed, comfy couch and coffee table that doubles as a little dining table. The furniture is new with a contemporary feel and light colored wood. The room had a mini fridge and microwave with dishes and sink. The location is convenient to restaurants & shopping. There are plenty of places to eat within a block or two. Plus my favorite club, Ruby Skye is right across the street. I'm always an a budget so if I can get a great deal again, I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Was in town for an Oracle Open World Convention of over 35,000 attendees and as you can imagine, most of the city was booked. We were very pleased with the location and the accomodations. The room was huge and the ammenities were excellent, i.e., king bed, nice feather pillows, soft sheets, refrigerator, microwave, toaster, coffee pot, tv, vcr, stereo, ironing board and iron, large bathroom, dressing area, build in cabinets, laptop table with bench, large sofa to relax on. I'd definitely go there again. Ate at the restaurant one night... that was good, but not excellent. Staff was very pleasant. Overall, they get an "A".

Reviews.Title: “Just like the photographs”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the 2nd week of August 2005. What a beautiful hotel, really stylish. All staff I came across were helpful and courteous, Cocktail barman knew his stuff and when he left 1 ingredient out of a cocktail, gave me a free one. Ate at the restaurant, food and service was excellent. Rooms were really clean and have a turn down service every night, which was an unexpected bonus. This is one of the few hotels I have stayed in where the publicity photos matched the reality. Location was satisfactory, just a few blocks from Union Square and the tram stops. Hotel gave us some great tips on how to get around the city easily and helped us return our hire car. Ok the carpets have seen better days and double glazing would be a benefit, but the many good points outway the very few bad ones. An excellent hotel, we would definetly stay again and would recommend others to.

Reviews.Title: “was very nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the middle of july for 3 nights. The concierge helped us with all the information we needed about our first stay in SF, the room was spacious and clean (very clean). We didn't go for breakfest, but we took tee to our rooms in the evening, which is for free. The hotel is one block from Union square, really great location, it tries to present itself as a luxurious smaller hotel in downtown SF, which it is. Two things last: first the bad: the remark about the hotel being "worn out" is true, the carpets could be changed, and a little more care could be showed by the "handyman departement", the good thing is valet parking downtown in the price of the room, saves 40$ a day. Overal conclusion: I recommend the hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: The Donatello Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 501 Post Street, cross street - Mason Street, San Francisco, CA 94102
